description:
2:22 A Ghost Story, Do You Believe in Ghosts?

In a rapidly gentrifying part of London, a married couple are renovating their new home. But something strange and frightening can be heard at the same time every night. What forces have they disturbed? Jenny has become convinced the house is haunted. Husband Sam isn’t having a bar of it. Tension builds throughout a housewarming dinner with friends as the clock ticks closer to 2:22… when a shocking truth will be revealed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
ALTAR: The Drag Rite of Balance and Blasphemy, Join us at Fringe Bar for ALTAR, a spellbinding drag ritual honouring the turn of the seasons. As day and night stand in perfect balance, witness an evening of witchcraft, blasphemy, mythology, and queer magic brought to life by a fierce coven of drag kings, queens, monsters, and cryptids.
This equinox, we invoke the primal, the divine, and the forbidden. Expect offerings to old gods, sacrificial glamour, and performances steeped in folklore, resistance and radical ritual. ALTAR is a celebration of queer power, transgressive beauty, and the defiance of a world that seeks to burn us at the stake.
With Performances By:
Robin Yablind
Rover Stimulation
Misty Frequency
Darryl Parton
Rocky Rhodes
MANNNTIS
Judas Kiss
Aracella
Cailiah the Banshee
Come ready to worship. Come ready to sin.
Bring your rage, your devotion, your offerings, and lay them down at the ALTAR!
Doors open 7.30pm
Show starts 8pm
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Abbie Chatfield | Wellington, Australia’s favourite chronic over-sharer, podcaster, TV star, and unapologetic truth-teller Abbie Chatfield is hitting the stage again – raw, unfiltered, and funnier than ever.
Fans and critics called it “the most relatable live show of the year” – with The West Australian praising Abbie’s “vulnerability and hilarious insight” as the secret sauce behind this unforgettable night of laughs, truth bombs, and too-real storytelling.
Whether you're a long-time fan or new to the chaos, this is your chance to see Abbie live doing what she does best – keeping it real and keeping it funny.

description:
All Roads Lead to Kapiti from Comedy on the Coast, All Roads Lead to Kapiti from Comedy on the Coast
Kapiti Coast, NZ – Prepare to swap your Netflix night for something far funnier—All Roads Lead to Kapiti rolls into the Kapiti Playhouse on 20 September. Doors open at 7:30 pm, the laughs land at 8:00 pm.

Line-Up That’ll Make You Snort-Laugh

Richie Faavesi – "The 2024 Raw Comedy Quest finalist (and Whanganui’s chocolate-humour king) brings brutally honest, father-and-husband-life tales with enough grit and heart to dark-horse the dark side of comedy."
NZ Herald

MC Marc Hamilton – The smooth operator keeping the laughs rolling and the mic mayhem in check.

Emma Jean – A raw new voice and one of the Raw Comedy Quest finalists for 2025—expect freshness, edge, and zero filter.

Reon Matterman – Thrives on weaving truth bombs with sharp wit—something you’ll want to laugh and think about.

Advait Kirtikar – "Qualified actuary by day, Billy T-nominated comedian by night. His super-dry delivery and razor timing earned him awards, accolades, and the uncanny ability to make actuarial science sound sexy. He’s also a two-degree black-belt rock-climber-ex-gymnast blend of absurdity."
Scoop

Kyle Southam - All the way from the Wairarapa with jokes from the edge of the world.

Why It Matters

This isn’t just comedy—it’s a cross-section of NZ's freshest and fiercest comedic voices, from local legends to rising stars. Whether you're in for the belly laughs, the smart quips, or just wondering if an actuary can be funny—this is your Saturday night.

A community event encouraging young ones (under 18) to express their creativity and share their aspirations for a peaceful, inclusive, and nuclear-free world.

description:
Auditions! Superior Donuts by Tracy Letts, Stagecraft presents: “Superior Donuts”
By Tracy Letts
Directed by James Kiesel
26 November – 6 December 2025
“What could be more human, than to be scared, and keep it a secret.”
Arthur Przybyszewski (that's (p)Shub-er-shef-ski), is the proprietor of a modest, behind-the-times donut shop in uptown Chicago. He can't seem to find joy in anything these days, not even the donuts he used to take such pride in making by hand. Vandals armed with spray paint, predatory landlords, and that nefarious Starbucks down the road all threaten to unceremoniously snuff out the only thing he's got left.
That is, until an upstart, ambitious young man shoulders his way into becoming a Superior Donuts employee, and an unlikely friendship (or is it a rivalry?) develops, inspiring both to face the demons they've been hiding from all this time.
This is a sharp-witted, heartfelt comedy by Pulitzer Prize winner Tracy Letts (“August: Osage County”) offering a warm and wry take on depression, diversity, and bravery that will leave you feeling all fluffy and sugary on the inside. Plus, who knows, you might get a donut!
Go to the Stagecraft website to book your spot!
https://www.stagecraft.co.nz/auditions
AUDITIONS:
Auditions will be on Saturday 13th & Sunday 14th September, with callbacks the evening of Monday 15th September.
To book an audition, please fill out the form by 10th September - we'll be in touch to confirm your audition date, time and location. If you have any questions please get in touch at auditions@stagecraft.co.nz.
Roles (just try your best with accents, coaching available once casting is complete)
Arthur Przybyszewski [Male, Polish, 50s - 60s]
The owner and operator of Superior Donuts. Old, grumpy, and more than a little depressed. Secretly an artisan and a scholar, he’s spent his whole life running from conflict. Until now? [Has a scene involving some violence]
Franco Wicks [Male, African-American, 20s]
Young, idealistic, a little pushy, and full of attitude and energy. Franco believes that good things will happen to him despite all odds, and evidence, to the contrary. A former employee of Luther.
Max [Male, Russian, 40s - 60s]
Owner of the DVD shop next door, Max is interested in buying Superior Donuts to expand his (tiny) capitalist empire. Fancies himself a self-made man. [Speaks in a Russian accent, along with some dialogue in Russian]
Randy [Female, Irish-American, 30s - 40s]
Raised in the middle of 7 brothers and working as a cop in the Chicago Police Department, Randy’s always been ‘one of the boys’. Big hockey fan. Has a soft spot for Arthur.
James [Male, African-American, 30s - 40s]
Another cop with the Chicago Police Department and Randy’s beat partner. Well-respected in the community and [not so] secretly a giant Star Trek nerd. [Will consider any and all BIPOC actors for this role]
Lady [Female, Irish-American, 60s - 70s]
Likely homeless and definitely a little hard-of-hearing, Lady is a well-known as a confusing-but-likeable, perhaps even mascot-like figure in the Uptown community. Well past the point of giving a crap about what other people think.
Luther [Male, Irish-American, 30s - 40s]
Local bookie and crime-syndicate everyman, Luther has scratched out his living taking money from gambling addicts, which he finds troubling because he’d like to consider himself a good, fair man. Has a stomach ulcer which is probably somehow representative of this inner conflict. [Has a scene involving some violence]
Kevin [Male, Irish, 20s]
Another of Luther’s employees, Kevin’s probably fallen into the wrong crowd as a young man, but it doesn’t seem to trouble him that much. Seems to care mostly about getting paid and drinking Coca-Cola.
Kiril [Male, Russian, 20s - 30s]
A shy man of few words (mostly ‘hello’), Kiril is an intimidating figure with a big soft heart beating beneath his tall muscular frame. Brought into the fold to be a construction worker and bodyguard, he’s mostly interested in falling in love with the local bartender. [Most dialogue is in Russian]
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
B.M.I : BAD MŌMONA INDIVIDUAL (playreading), B.M.I : BAD MŌMONA INDIVIDUAL (playreading)
Created by Īhaka Martyn. Play read by Kaisa Fa'atui.

Tired of having no room for self love? Maybe burning 50kgs in 50 minutes will change that.

Join our inspiring fitness guru as he shows the audience how to shed your ego and excess fat. By utilising the power of manifestation, you too can change your pathetic little impulses. In fact, when was the last time you went to the gym? Maybe you should just skip this show and hit the treadmill instead, yeah?

Filled with self-helpless tips, banging tunes and kōrero hōhonu, this playreading will dissect the fraught relationships we have with our tinana, and where those nasty thoughts are really coming from.

Catfish Trifecta presents: Improv on a plate, Welcome to Improv on a Plate, the comedy tasting menu no one ordered and everyone regrets.
In this unholy fusion of high-stakes improv and low-stakes judgment, three deranged guest chefs (aka format-pitchers) take the stage with one mission: serve up the most unhinged, impossible improv formats they can dream of. Enter Wellington comedy trio, Catfish Trifecta — your unsuspecting improv victims — who must swallow each cursed format whole and perform it on the spot.
No script. No escape. Just raw, unfiltered chaos served à la mode.

description:
Chloe's Revenge, Written and performed by Chloe Bettina

Part love letter, part exposé, Chloe’s Revenge is a musical theatre-inspired show that pulls back the curtain on the pro-am musical theatre “industry” in Aotearoa. With biting wit, Chloe lays bare the heartbreak of rejection from the world she adores, and turns that pain into power.

This is a story of survival, self-discovery, and the ultimate comeback: becoming the best version of yourself when the system says you don’t belong. You don't have to be a "musical theatre person" to enjoy this show. In fact, it's better if you're not.

This show was created as part of the TAHI Festival 2025 Creative Residency programme, in partnership with Creative NZ, BATS Theatre, and with support from Auckland Theatre Company.

Audience Care: Contains course language
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Christmas in October, Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's nowhere near beginning to look anything like Christmas, but if October in Wellington is true to form, the weather outside is probably frightful, so we're celebrating anyway. Wear your best ugly sweater for this celebration of the Christmas season, featuring gifts (real), eggnog (imaginary) and warm feelings (both).

Featuring a found family of amazing performers from across the Festival, together on stage for the very first time.

“If you want to laugh till your belly hurts, watch wizards weave worlds out of thin air, and be a part of something special, inimitable, then catch as many NZIF shows as you can.” - Regional News

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Crazy Ladies, Pamela Browne has organised a 25 year reunion for her four best friends from High School. From the moment Kay, now a chocoholic gun-toting funeral director arrives, the wheels begin falling off Pamela’s meticulously planned weekend.
Added to the mix is Sandy, who is now a Nun, Dianne, married the school nerd and is a mother of eight sons, Rachel, a runaway teenager on a mission to dig up some dirt on her mother, and Shaun, the greasy motel janitor, who ends up in a compromising position in the ladies’ wardrobe.
Guns, gags, cuffs, crucifixes, sleaze-balls , slander, pizza and pinot – everything you need for a great weekend reunion!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Dance with Janni, Dance with Janni
Conscious dance is part free form dance and part relaxation. It promotes creative self-expression, has some great health benefits and is for everyone to enjoy.This is a safe and inclusive space to move and dance while having the opportunity to relax, stretch and be your true self.There are no steps to learn, instead there will be minimal guidance to help you during the session.Bring water, a small blanket, socks or dance barefoot and wear comfy clothes move in, even if that includes sparkles.This initiative has the support of Creative Communities NZ.Koha entry - pay what you feel is fair for our time together.

Also check out other Health & Wellness events in Lower Hutt.
label: Arts & Theatre

Dance with Janni, Dance with Janni is part free form dance and part relaxation. The ritual of dance promotes creative self-expression, has some great health benefits and is for everyone to enjoy.
This is a safe and inclusive space to move and dance while having the opportunity to relax, stretch and be your true self.
There are no steps to learn, instead there will be minimal guidance to help you during the session.
Bring water, a small blanket, socks or dance barefoot and wear comfy clothes move in. Come as you are and as you feel.
This initiative has the support of Creative Communities NZ.
Koha appreciated.

description:
Echoes of the Past, Presented by Best on Tap

In keeping with the theme of the festival, Best on Tap ponders what has led us to 'be here now'?

What people, actions and objects have combined to shape this place we know as Wellington/Te Whanganui a Tara?

What paths have led us to make this our home?

What decisions, genes and character traits echo through generations to make us who we are today?

This show will traverse time to explore these rich themes, all with a good helping of Best on Tap truth based, grounded spontaneous theatre.

After all, what were our ancestors doing if not improvising?

Inspired by Felipe Ortiz (Colombia)

Best on Tap is a Wellington-based improvisation troupe who use truth-based play to create compelling and satisfying narratives. This is spontaneous theatre that honours and entertains.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. Basil, Manuel and Sybil are in town—and they’re bringing a healthy dose of mayhem to your door. Fully immersive, highly interactive and completely original, this is the show where anything can happen and usually does—and with 70% of the show improvised, it’s never the same twice. Join us for GISH: Live at Abandoned Taproom Petone!

Date: Saturday, 25 October 2025
Time: 7:30pm - 9:30pm
Location: Abandoned Taproom Petone, Lower Hutt, Wellington Region

Comedy icon GISH is back with a brand-new tour across Aotearoa. For over 20 years, GISH has been one of New Zealand’s most beloved comedians, famous for his outrageous parodies that mix six strings with dodgy things. Get ready for a night where no song is safe. Joining him is Canadian freestyle sensation Jesse Firebrand, a razor-sharp musical comedian known for lightning-fast improvisation comedy songs, tearing through the Australian scene, with no one in New Zealand doing what he does. Your host for the night is Anthony Wilson, an Auckland-based comic and crowd favourite who has performed across Aotearoa, Australia, and the UK, known for quick wit, polished storytelling, and pub-worthy tales. There will also be a special guest on the night.

description:
Grass Roots, Written and performed by Raureti Ormond.

Grass Roots is a heartfelt and charming musical about the colossal culture of rugby. From club fields to Eden Park, a queer boy embarks on an epic odyssey through the New Zealand Rugby ages. Join him in this historical exploration of takatāpuitanga, masculinity, fatherhood, and what it means to grow up in Aotearoa. Created for rangatahi and whānau, this powerful story speaks to all generations.

This show was created as part of the TAHI Festival 2025 Creative Residency programme, in partnership with Creative NZ and Taki Rua Productions.

Audience Care: Recommended for audiences aged 13+. Contains mild coarse language.

Directed by Campbell Wright
27th August - 8th September
The Gryphon Theatre
Iron follows the rekindling of a relationship between Josie and her estranged mother Fay who is currently serving a life sentence for killing Josie's father. Josie seeks to understand the events that she barely has any memory of, while Fay attempts to live life vicariously through her. As the play develops, we discover how incarceration has affected all of the parties involved, including the prison guards.

description:

Expect nothing less than the power of the word steeped in truth and machete-sharpened wit from this New Zealand Samoan poetry pantheon.
5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum
Thursday 4 September | 6pm–8pm
Tickets: $25–$35

About Tusiata Avia
Tusiata Avia MNZM is a poet, writer and performer. She has published 5 books of poetry, children’s books, short film, radio documentary. Her iconic play Wild Dogs Under My Skirt showed Off-Broadway in 2020, where it won the Fringe Encore Outstanding Production of the Year. Her most recent play, The Savage Coloniser Show won Best New Play at Wellington Theatre Awards 2024. Both plays are based on books of poetry of the same name.
Tusiata was awarded a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to poetry and in 2024, the Prime Ministers Award for Literary Achievement: Poetry.

This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.

Rooted in mātauranga Māori, this gathering invites you to connect with whenua through creative practice, explore the stories and significance of kōkōwai, and contribute to a collaborative artwork honouring mana wāhine. This event is designed for Māori and Tāngata Moana — no experience needed, just a willingness to get your hands in the earth and your heart in the kaupapa!
Places are limited. So bookings are essential. Please register through the following link to reserve your place.

description:
MAMIL 2: GOMIL, One of New Zealand’s most successful plays of all time, MAMIL (Middle Aged Man in Lycra) is hitting the road in a national tour of the long-awaited sequel GOMIL (Grumpy Old Man in Lycra).

Starring acting legend Mark Hadlow ONZM (King Kong, The Hobbit, SNAG) and written and directed by Gregory Cooper (MAMIL, That Bloody Woman), GOMIL reunites this dream team who is directly responsible for causing laughter lines on the faces of over 70,000 people who saw MAMIL!

“Fast-paced and slick” - Theatreview

GOMIL follows the journey of Wayne, the founder and team leader of the men's cycling group in MAMIL. A lot has happened to Wayne over the last 10 years. He has retired, his son has moved to London with his grandchildren and Maggie, his wife of 49 years, passed away suddenly a year ago. For Wayne, his family and his work were his life. They were the source of his life's pleasure and purpose and now he is having to cope with the loss of both.

The only thing left to take his mind off the pain is cycling with his MAMIL friends, especially Bryan, the central character of MAMIL. But a panic attack mid-ride and a crash with catastrophic consequences leads to a crisis of cycling confidence and the inability to do the thing he loves the most.

Like MAMIL, it takes an array of characters to help the central character rediscover what is truly important when their life seems adrift and meaningless. A relentlessly positive Scottish counsellor, a philosophical Romanian personal trainer, Wayne’s new arch-enemy in the form of an ocker Ozzie retirement village owner who grinds his gears and yes, even Pinarello -- the Italian bike of Bryan’s and Wayne’s nightmares -- all wittingly and unwittingly help Wayne get back on the bike and realise he still has something to offer, he still has a purpose and most importantly a reason to get out of bed every morning aside from going for a piss.

“An engaging and earnest work of art, packed with
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
MAMIL 2: GOMIL, The Lycra is back: GOMIL – the hilarious new sequel to MAMIL hits the road across New Zealand!

One of New Zealand’s biggest theatrical success stories is back in the saddle! Following the phenomenal popularity of MAMIL (Middle Aged Man in Lycra), which played to over 70,000 people across the country, comes its laugh-out-loud sequel: GOMIL – Grumpy Old Man in Lycra. And this time, it's going national.

From the comedic genius of writer and director Gregory Cooper (MAMIL, That Bloody Woman) and starring Kiwi acting royalty Mark Hadlow ONZM (King Kong, The Hobbit, SNAG), GOMIL is primed to bring a fresh wave of laughter, Lycra, and life’s mid-life absurdities to 14 cities throughout New Zealand in a major national tour kicking off this September.

After a critically acclaimed, sold-out debut season in Ōtautahi Christchurch, GOMIL is shifting gears and going full speed ahead across Aotearoa. Audiences who laughed (and winced) along with the unforgettable antics in MAMIL will now follow the journey of our favourite cyclist as he faces a new life stage: grumpier, greyer, and still clad in way too much Lycra.

Hadlow, one of the country’s most beloved performers, reprises his role with impeccable comic timing and emotional depth, bringing to life a story that’s not only hilarious, but also touching, timely, and unashamedly relatable.

Whether you're a weekend warrior, a reluctant spouse, or just someone who enjoys watching others sweat the small (and stretchy) stuff, GOMIL is a must-see. This show digs deep into the world of ageing men, fragile egos, friendship, family, and the undeniable need to keep moving—no matter how creaky your knees may be.

Get ready to laugh, reflect, and maybe even wince in recognition as GOMIL pedals its way across the country this spring. It’s more than a show—it’s a celebration of growing older (and slightly wider) with humour, heart, and a healthy dose of spandex.

Don’t miss the next chapter in this iconic Kiwi comedy saga. GOMIL is coming to a theatre near you - lycra, laughter and all.

--
For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Manage Your Expectations | Circa Theatre, You decide the ending...
Solo performer Eliza Sanders has a simple task: to tell you everything that will happen in the show, so you can decide if you would like to see it. Nothing is ever so simple.
This genre-defying work of dance, theatre, live film, clown and absurd philosophising takes the idea of the ‘trigger warning’ to its absurdist extreme to question how ‘informed’ consent can really be, and asking ‘How much do you really want to know?’
Created and performed by multi-award-winning maverick of the stage, Eliza Sanders, Manage Your Expectations helps us to see the limits of the power to communicate and our failures to say what we mean. Through movement, multimedia, and razor-sharp wit, it examines the impossibility of perfect communication, musing on the influence of context, identity and personal history while creating something beautiful from our collective mess.
"Clever, witty, evocative, subversive, immersive, despairing, poignant, personal and universal" — Deirdre Tarrant, Theatreview, 2024
"Beautifully vulnerable" - Chloe Jaques, Theatreview, 2024
Full of vigour, energy, chaos and a hint of confrontation, Manage Your Expectations is a mind (and body) bending show about how we connect in an increasingly complex world. And you decide the ending…
Content warning: this show contains explicit content, mild coarse language, heavy nudity, themes of abortion and rape.
WINNER: Best Performer, Whangārei Fringe 2024
WINNER: Outstanding Solo Performance, NZ Fringe 2024
WINNER: San Diego Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Best in Fringe, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Most Innovative Work, NZ Fringe 2024

description:
Monument, Sculpting the future of our nation

“Succession meets Barbie” -Showcase Victoria
Edith Aldridge is the youngest woman to be elected leader of her country. In a lush presidential suite, she has just ninety minutes to get ready for the most monumental day of her life. But things are not going to plan. Due to heavy fog, her team is stuck in another city. Enter Rosie, a twenty-two year old makeup artist from the David Jones counter, sent last minute to help Edith get camera ready.
From very different worlds, these two women, though face to face, do not see eye to eye in this provocative, slick and funny play that is “sparkling fresh and urgently of the now”.

The team that brought you PRIMA FACIE, brings you this dynamic new work that “explores the role that makeup and fashion play in how we perceive and receive women in power.” -review quotes from Arts Hub & Australian Arts Review.


Written by Emily Sheehan
Produced by Kavanah Productions & BRAVE Theatre
Directed by Lyndee-Jane Rutherford

description:
O FORTUNA (Carmina Burana & Chichester Psalms), O FORTUNA (Carmina Burana & Chichester Psalms)
Prepare for a night of musical grandeur as Orpheus Choir Wellington and Auckland Choral, New Zealand’s largest city choirs, unite to present Orff’s monumental Carmina Burana. With its apocalyptic opening, O Fortuna, this masterpiece explores the capricious nature of fate, the joys and sorrows of life, and the boundless energy of human passion.

This performance will be mighty in scale, with nearly 300 performers on stage, including a children’s chorus, the combined power of two elite choirs, and the dynamic sound of the Wellington Brass Band. Add to this the extraordinary talents of soloists Emma Pearson (soprano), Coco Diaz (countertenor), and James Harrison (baritone), along with celebrated New Zealand pianists Jian Liu and Diedre Irons, and you have a musical event of epic proportions. From the raucous revelry of In Taberna (In the Tavern) to the sensual stillness of In Trutina (In the Balance), Carmina Burana is a visceral and unforgettable experience.

The concert opens with Bernstein’s radiant Chichester Psalms, a joyous blend of rhythmic vitality and heartfelt spirituality, providing the perfect prelude to the drama and intensity of Orff’s masterpiece.

RESERVE YOUR SEAT TODAY FOR THIS EPIC EVENT.

description:
Octavia - A VATS Production!, COME TO OUR CLOSING NIGHT FOR A DIRECTOR Q&A!

Welcome back to another night of ancient theatre with the one and only Victoria Ancient Theatre Society! VATS is a student-led club at Victoria University of Wellington that puts on an ancient play annually, celebrating the fusion of Classical Studies and Theatre, to learn from, and to experience in full. This years' experience comes in the form of the Roman tragedy Octavia—the only extant Roman play set in the eternal city of Rome.

Often attributed to Seneca, but likely in truth penned by an unknown playwright we know as Pseudo-Seneca under the Flavian dynasty, Octavia is a hard tragedy depicting the divorce and hardships of the titular Octavia—the first wife of Emperor Nero.

Follow our tragic heroine as she bears the weight of her Julio-Claudian family name and all the expectations that are thrust upon her with it. Bear witness the cruelty of Emperor Nero and his crimes driven by an unbridled and unabated passion. Experience the illustriousness of a grand imperial wedding and follow it with the bloodied remains left by the ruthlessness of Roman politics. Shall Octavia survive this brutal game? Come find out, for you are cordially invited...

description:
Oops! All Donkeys, Directed by Christine Brooks

Make. Pull. Carry. Work. Repeat.

Donkeys! Are you not tired? Atomised and alienated? It’s time to lay down your burdens and join us at our retreat. Be among friends. Feel the cool gleam of the moon upon your ears. Find and then heal your inner donkey. A most rare vision awaits.

From the creator of Love Isthmus: Dystopia Edition (“a truly bizarre and apocalyptic hour of improv” - The Wellingtonista), Murder on a Boat (“really, really, really good” - Regional News), and The Solarpunk Archives (“creative antics that leave the audience howling with laughter” - Theatreview) comes this festival premiere of the show concept that came to the director in a dream.

description:
Over and Out @ TAHI Festival, "NEVER become a truck driver!" - A young Jackson Burling took that advice, avoiding the fork in the road, but now, after a long and gruelling two year slog in the arts industry he must confront that age old question: "why not, Dad?" - and take us along for the ride.
In ‘Over and Out’, premiering at the 2025 TAHI Festival, he’ll bring you a REAL interview, a BIG character, and even bigger QUESTIONS to the stage. One actor. 50 minutes. Countless emotional potholes
Along the way, we get a rare look into the gritty, heartfelt, and often-overlooked life of one of Aotearoa’s essential workers — the truck driver
Is the open road calling — or is the stage his true destination?
Buckle up. This is verbatim theatre with serious mileage.
Created and Performed by Jackson Burling
Directed by Simon Leary | Produced by Tom Smith

description:
Porirua, Porirua
Kristyl Neho's one-woman show, Tangihanga, is a drama-comedy that runs for 60 minutes. The story centers on Jess, a loving daughter whose father, Karanipa, has just passed away. The play unfolds at the Marae as Karanipa's family and friends gather to mourn his loss.
Neho takes on the challenge of playing over 30 characters, showcasing the complex dynamics and rising tensions that emerge during the tangi. As secrets are exposed and family members grapple with their grief, the play explores themes of family relationships, identity, cultural traditions, and the crucial role of community during times of loss

description:
ROADKILL: The Uber-cool Musical - TAHI Festival: CANCELLED, Hey everyone- we have a little change of plans!
Unfortunately, ROADKILL: The Uber-Cool Musical won’t be happening this time around, but we’re already cooking up something even better for the future. All ticket holders will receive a full refund and we can’t wait to welcome you to our next big adventure.
Thank you for your excitement and your support.

CANCELLED-


ROADKILL The Uber-Cool Musical takes you on a wildly immersive journey through love, life and rock ’n’ roll — all from the back seat of a van. This intimate one-man musical combines humour, heart and unforgettable tunes for an experience like no other.
Strap in for the rollercoaster ride of your life as we take a regular mundane occurrence of driving in an Uber and blow wide open the private life, memories and miss happenings of our hero, and driver, Terry.

Carpool karaoke meets intense love story meets wild murder mystery.

Much more than a musical, its an experience, its a journey and an attraction!

In the space of a usual cabaret show and with the help of the passengers in the van, you will witness and be part of, childhood dreams, births, deaths and marriages, high drama, dark comedy, all sung live with a kickass, original, meatloaf-esque rock soundtrack. Surprises and magic ensues as we push the van, and Terry, to the limits of what is possible.

This will be an intimate, sensory overload, in a van. A full grand musical with all the bells and whistles.

With only 9 seats available each ride, grab your mates and have a private experience in the fast lane!
The hottest ticket in town- be sure to experience the ride of your life!

The show is in the style of a musical crossed with karaoke songs you have never heard before...

The van will be stationary and parked for this initial season.

Winner of BEST IN FRINGE and EMERGING ARTIST OF THE YEAR at the Dunedin Fringe and Winner of MOST INNOVATIVE at the NZ Fringe awards this year!

description:
Ravel’s opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges', New Zealand School of Music Classical Performance students present four performances Ravel's engagingly magical opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges' at the Hannah Playhouse directed by Sara Brodie, conducted by Martin Riseley with the New Zealand School of Music orchestra.
Performed in French with surtitles, the show is suitable for all ages. The story involves a 'child' (L'enfant) whose awful behaviour brings an unexpected response: first the furniture rebels, the grandfather clock, the broken china cup, then the mathematics tutor and the Princess in the fairy tale book come to life, and eventually all the animals in the garden - squirrels, dragonfly, birds rise up - all of whom have good reason to 'teach the child a lesson'. It's a fabulous journey that we go on with the child who is confronted by all of these and indeed learns...
This is a project involving the whole of the Classical Performance programme: the voice students sing all the roles, each performing several roles, the NZSM orchestra will play for the performances, and the piano students are taking part as rehearsal pianists (répétiteurs) and playing in the orchestra.

description:
Roger Hall's Easy Money, A comedy plot driven farce loosely based on Ben Johnson’s Jacobean Tale The Alchemist, set in the current day. A laugh a minute tale of greed, described by Hall as having “no moral, no message – just entertainment”

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)
Directed by Teresa Sullivan
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Saturday Laughs with Ben Hurley and Josh Thomson, Saturday Laughs returns to the Upper Hutt Cossie Club, with another great line up of top Kiwi comedy

With MC Ben Hurley
As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more
With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room. A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.

And headline act Josh Thomson
Josh is a household name and a legend on the New Zealand comedy scene. He has been a mainstay on local comedy shows like 7Days, Have You Been Paying Attention, was the regular comedian on The Project and was the champion of Season 3 of TaskMaster NZ – which he now directs. He also directed and starred in a web series about his own father Subject:Dad.

As an actor he’s appeared internationally in Prime’s The Office Australia, Netflix’s The New Legends Of Monkey, NBC’s Young Rock and local hits Good Grief, Creamerie, Wellington Paranormal, Educators, Time Bandits and the Emmy winning INSiDE. His feature film work includes the How to Please a Woman (Australia), Don’t Make Me Go (US), and local favourites Gary of the Pacific, Pork Pie, & Guns Akimbo.

Josh continues to work as a live performer, whether gigging on tour with 7DaysLive, appearing on the Comedy Gala, hosting the Great Comedy Debate or as an MC for corporate events. He’s hosted the NZ Film Awards, the 48Hour Film awards, various Vodafone events and several spots for the NZ Music awards.

Support from


Li'i Alaimoana

Sera Devcich

Katy Borrows



Book early and often!

This event made possible with support from the Upper Hutt Creative Communities scheme, and Aotearoa Gaming Trust

description:
Scene Painting, Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's the final show of the 2025 New Zealand Improv Festival, and we're bringing together some of our favourite performers for a once-in-a-lifetime show.

Improvisers will often paint a scene, using narration to conjure images in the mind of the audience. But what if they could actually paint the scene?

Thanks to the generous support of Resene Paints, we'll be doing just that: actually painting our scenes onto the stage and walls at BATS. Come send off the Festival with a messy, beautiful explosion of colour!

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Small Towns, Kiwi Summers, Presented by Tempest Theatre Co.

Directed by Emma Maguire

Forests, beaches, unbearable ennui — it's no picnic being from one of the most rural places in Aotearoa. Sometimes the best day of your life is sitting in a horrible carpark outside the Warewhare cause there's nothing else to do.

There's a tragedy in being in a place that's so far away from everywhere else. On the longest day of summer, join my friends and yours as we dream, wonder, and hope that things aren't going to change too much come February.

An improvised dramedy about leaving home, finding your feet, and fighting your way out of the wop-wops.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content. The show may contain strong language and mature themes, including but not limited to mental health and homophobia. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

So There I Was: A Storytelling Show, Graduates of the NZ Comedy School storytelling workshop are here to enrapture you with some true tales. If you love the Moth and This American Life, you'll love this. Some stories are funny, some fearsome, but all are entertaining!
Special guest pro MC TBA
Don't miss it!

description: Social Animal, Created by Stephen Papps and Damon Andrews. Performed by Stephen Papps.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Social Animal, Created by Stephen Papps and Damon Andrews. Performed by Stephen Papps.

You can’t teach an old dog new tricks... can you? Biting satire and theatre wizardry fuse in a comically inventive roller-coaster about the fear of irrelevance and the healing power of an animal. Award-winning actor, writer, and solo performer, Stephen Papps, plays twelve characters with beguiling virtuosity, in this gloriously funny solo tour de force about a man who loses face in a desperate attempt to regain his relevance.

“It’s impressive for a performer to embody a big range of characters ... well-written and full of humorous insights and revelations ... glorious!” – Cate Prestige, Theatreview.

Audience care: Recommended for audiences aged 13+
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like, THIS SHOW IS R16.

Friends to the End - Presented by Wiremu Tuhiwai & Brendon Bennetts

Join Wiremu and Brendon as their friendship is tested by an alien invasion, or a robot uprising, or a zombie outbreak, or whatever else the audience might suggest.

Inspired by movies like Shaun of the Dead, The World’s End, and Scott Pilgrim vs the World, prepare for a show that mixes sincerity and over the top action into a joyful improvisational maelstrom. After all, the real apocalypse is the friends we make along the way.

Living is Like - Directed by Andrea Ferpo

Once upon a time, there was someone who felt growing up was like constantly being at university, another for whom falling in love was like playing roulette in a casino, and another whose jealousy was like eating spicy food every day.

Living Is Like harnesses the power of metaphor to unleash the hidden emotions behind our everyday actions, the way we think about ourselves, and how we view each other.

R16 - As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description: St. Theresa's School Production 2025 - LEST WE FORGET, Set in both New Zealand and the narrow trenches of Gallipoli, Lest We Forget tells the powerful story of New Zealand civilians, soldiers and nurses who find courage, friendship and hope in the face of war. As letters from home arrive and battles rage on, they share laughter, sorrow, and dreams of returning to Aotearoa. This school production honours the Kiwi spirit and sacrifices made during one of our nation’s most defining campaigns. A moving tribute not to be missed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
String Bean Puppets: Once In a Full Moon, Be captivated these school holidays by the gorgeous puppet show, Once in a Full Moon, performed by Anna Bailey of String Bean Puppets.

Deep in the bush, a lonely kiwi looks up at the sky and mistakes the full moon for a giant egg. Can kiwis fly? Can moons fall from the sky? Can wishes come true? This magical string puppet adventure introduces the audience to an intimate encounter with a few of Aotearoa New Zealand's special native creatures.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
String Bean Puppets: The Tree Friends, This interactive puppet show performed by String Bean is a beautiful story about the struggle against invasive weed species.

Kereru and Millie are best friends. When a baby kohekohe tree is left orphaned in a storm, they work together to protect him from the invaders. Not all Green is Good!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Tangihanga 2025 - Porirua, Tangihanga 2025 - Porirua
Tangihanga is a 75-minute solo drama-comedy performed by Kristyl Neho. The story follows Jess, a loving daughter returning to the marae to mourn the death of her father, Karanipa. As whānau and friends gather for the tangi, secrets are revealed, tensions rise, and old wounds resurface.
Through a masterful solo performance, Kristyl embodies over 30 characters, weaving together humour, grief, and cultural ritual to explore the emotional layers of loss, memory, and identity.

You may also like the following events from Kristyl.Neho:

Also check out other Performances in Porirua, Arts events in Porirua, Theatre events in Porirua.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Tangihanga, Created and performed by Kristyl Neho

Tangihanga is a solo drama-comedy centred around Jess - a devoted daughter whose father, Karanipa, has passed away. As Jess’ whānau gathers at the marae to mourn, tensions rise, secrets are revealed, and long-held family dynamics begin to unravel. Neho masterfully embodies over 30 characters, capturing the complexity of grief, cultural identity, and the strength of whānau. This bold, emotionally charged, and often hilarious performance speaks to the heart of Aotearoa.

“A graceful celebration of the power of theatre to create and tell a story.” - Tanya Piejus, Regional News

Audience care: Contains themes of grief and loss. Recommended for audiences aged 9+.

description:
The Art of Ikebana exhibition, Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.
Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.
Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm
Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.
This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Dictionary of Moments, Directed By Jason Geary

This isn’t your ordinary dictionary.

Here, you won’t find dry definitions — instead, every word unlocks a moment from a story that brings its meaning to life.

Drawing from his acclaimed short story podcast of the same name, Jason Geary reinvents storytelling onstage with this bold hybrid of live-written tales and spontaneous scenes. Each performance is a one-of-a-kind experience where language leaps off the page and into vivid, unscripted life.

Part literary experiment, part theatrical adventure — words have never been this alive.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. Spend a night with Lia as she fills the sleepless hours of the morning in real-time. Get to know her and influence her decisions in this award-nominated durational theatre experience.

Attend the show live at Two/Fifty Seven Willis Street or tune into our live streams on Twitch and YouTube. Show starts at 11:59pm on Saturday 20th September and runs for 7 hours.

description:
There Once Was a Boy..., Written and performed by Robert Lloyd

A boy is stranded at sea. A storm bears down on him, and, in what he believes are his final moments, he ponders his life and the choice he made to come here—to explore what’s over the curious horizon—and wonders: Was this a mistake? There once was a boy… is a fun, poetic performance for tweens, teens and their whānau. This live “pop-up book” explores curiosity, courage, and finding light in the darkness.

Recommended for audiences aged 10+. Contains flashing lights.

This show was created as part of the TAHI Festival 2025 Creative Residency programme, in partnership with Creative NZ, PAYPA and Toi Poneke Arts Centre.

Please take your seats in this cabaret classroom as lecturer-performer Glenn Horsfall leads a hilarious, heartfelt lesson in what happens when life doesn’t go to plan. Featuring beautiful songs from a mix of beloved and lesser-known musical theatre favourites, and stories full of humour, heart, and reflection, this award-winning solo show invites you to embrace every version of yourself.

description:
WOW 6 Day Stay & Play, Fly return to Wellington, unpack your bags in a luxury hotel then stay and play in the Capital for 6 exciting days away. With just an elevator ride to Lampton Quay and the Cable Car - what more could you want?


This is the perfect launching pad to experience the best of Wellington and its surrounding regions. We explore the settlement of Greytown, enjoy wine in Martinborough, appreciate the conservation efforts of Kapiti Island and discover the arts, streets and politics of Wellington central.


We top this off with Platinum Passes to the World of WearableArt (WOW) show!

Wai Art Show, Enjoy the Wairarapa’s largest cash & carry art show event!

The Wai Art Show exhibits a diverse and exquisite range of 2D and 3D artworks by local artists and from across New Zealand. The 3-day event attracts over 3,000 visitors and coincides with the Carterton Daffodil Day – an event not to be missed by art lovers!

description:
Wellington Law Revue 2025 - Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes), With the local elections looming, the Wellington City Council is divided. The National-led government wants to intervene, appointing none other than the Monopoly Man (yes the one from the board game!) to the job of fixing the Council. What they didn’t see coming is that this money-grabbing billionaire has his own personal agenda: money, money, money.

Meanwhile, four flatmates are stunned to find a new Mega Cycle Lane has been built through their front garden. Trying to get to the bottom of this, the flatmates unravel a sinister conspiracy that leads back to one man...

The Monopoly Man!

Can our heroes bankrupt our villain on the Monopoly board and beat him at his own game? Find out at the 2025 production of the Wellington Law Revue: Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes) presented by Peaches and Cream.

Please be advised that this production includes short sequences of flashing lights.
label: Arts & Theatre

BYO coffee (Zampelles is a great option) pop in to the Collective and see what The Networkers is all about! Create awesome local opportunities as you meet other positive businesspeople and hear from some great speakers.

We offer a 2-week free visitor policy, allowing you to explore the meeting and decide if it's right for you before making a decision.

If this sounds like you, let us know as we’d love to meet you.

Register your interest on - https://www.thenetworkers.co.nz/visit-group or email

You may also like the following events from The Networkers Lower North Island:
Next Monday, 8th September, 11:30 pm, Lower Hutt Business Networking in Lower Hutt
Also check out other Meetups in Wellington, Business events in Wellington.

description:
Marlborough Tech Community Morning Tea: Shaping Our Future, Marlborough Tech Community Morning Tea: Shaping Our Future
Marlborough’s tech community has big potential and it’s time to shape the next chapter together.

Event details
� Date: Thursday 18 September 2025
� Time: 10:00 am - 12:00 pm�
Location: Te Au Pūngao, cnr Arthur & Seymour Streets
Free to attend, registration is essential for catering purposes.

Join us for morning tea at Te Au Pūngao to connect with others working in technology, innovation, and startups, and help set the direction for our region’s tech future.

We’ll be talking about:Making coworking more accessible for sole contractors, early-stage founders, and startups. Creating regular opportunities for local students to get hands-on support from industry experts. Forming a Marlborough Tech Steering Group to guide our community and develop a Tech Community Charter.

Whether you’re building a startup, freelancing in tech, developing software, designing hardware, or exploring emerging technologies your voice matters.
This is an open, inclusive kōrero. Come along, share your ideas, and help create a connected, collaborative tech community in Marlborough.

Also check out other Business events in Blenheim.

description:
Retina NZ AGM 2025, Retina NZ AGM 2025
It's that time of the year again!

Come along to hear about what we have managed to achieve in the 2024/25 financial year, our goals for the future, and listen to our fantastic line-up of guest speakers!

There will be a catered lunch, as well as tea and coffee breaks - if you have any dietary requirements, please send us a message on here or to so we can accommodate you.

This event will be held in person at the Blind Low Vision Offices in Wellington at 121 Adelaide Road, and via Zoom.

description:
Startup World Cup New Zealand Final, For the first time ever, Kāpiti will host the Startup World Cup New Zealand Final, powered by Pegasus Tech Ventures – the world’s largest startup pitch competition.

Startups from across the motu will go head-to-head in front of a live audience and expert judging panel at the beautiful Te Raukura ki Kāpiti. The winner will receive flights and support to pitch on the global stage in Silicon Valley on 17 October 2025, competing for a USD $1 million investment prize.

This inaugural event is more than a pitch night – it’s a high-energy celebration of New Zealand’s creativity, capability, and ambition. Expect standout founder pitches, insight from leading judges, and a vibrant crowd of innovators, investors, and changemakers.

--
For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

description:
VicASA's Careers Panel, Step into the world of accounting and commerce with an exclusive chance to connect directly with professionals from BDO, CAANZ (and more international firms!).
This event isn’t just another panel - it’s your opportunity to gain real-world insights into the industry, discover the ins and outs of the recruitment process, and explore the many career paths available in accounting.
You’ll hear first-hand stories from experts, get practical tips on career development, and have the chance to ask the questions that matter most to you. Whether you’re curious about day-to-day life in the field, planning your career direction, or gearing up for internships and grad roles, this event is designed to give you the clarity and confidence to take your next step.

Info about the teacher:
Guinean percussionist Sibo Bangoura grew up in Matam – the heart of Conakry’s arts precinct – surrounded by a family of griots. His mother was a singer and his father abalafon player. Sibo absorbed the rhythm from his infancy and began to study percussion formally at the age of 12. At 14, he joined Boka Junior ensemble and then played with Ballet Matam for many years, until he moved to Australia.
Sibo currently resides in Sydney and travels to China, Japan, Singapore and Thailand to teach and perform. He plays with his brothers Mohamed and Epizo Bangoura and has a successful 8-piece band Keyim Ba
If you have ANY questions please feel free to get in touch with Bridget xo

description:
2-Day Kali Seminar with Stephen Brown from Inosanto Academy in CA, Want to learn the exact martial art skills as used in the Bourne films? Wellington this is your chance...
Tactical Survival Academy is hosting Senior Instructor Stephen Brown from the renowned Inosanto Academy of Martial Arts in Marina Del Rey, Los Angeles!
With over 40 years of martial arts experience and 36 years training under Guro Dan Inosanto, Stephen is one of only two instructors currently teaching Kali classes at the academy alongside Guro Dan Inosanto himself.
Stephen specializes in the Filipino Martial Art of Kali, as passed down through Guro Inosanto’s lineage. His training background also includes extensive experience in Muay Thai, Silat, Western Boxing, Jeet Kune Do, Savate and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.
Over the decades, Stephen has worked with:
* Multiple branches of Law Enforcement, Military units and Special Forces.
* Actors, stunt performers, and executives in the film and television industry.
* As a fight choreographer for screen productions.
Known for his precision, adaptability, and deep respect for the cultural roots of the arts he teaches, Stephen brings a wealth of knowledge and embodied experience to every seminar.
Currently based in Marina Del Rey, CA, Stephen is excited to share the Kali method of Guro Inosanto with the New Zealand martial arts community.
• Location: Mt Cook School Hall, 160 Tory Street, Te Aro
• Dates: Sat Sept 6 + Sun Sept 7
• Time: 1:30pm – 4:30pm (both days)
• Cost: One Day Only (Sat or Sun) $140 / Both Days $260
• Registration Closing Date: Wed Sept 3rd
Bookings Email: contact@tacticalsurvival.co.nz

description:
Accounting in the AI Era | Wellington, Mixing micro-products, bots, and off-the-shelf AI can disrupt - leaving work fragmented. What's missing is a unified AI vision and strategy.
Your investment in AI needs to solve our industry's biggest challenges - a talent shortage, productivity and responsiveness to client needs.
Join Zato at their official NZ launch.
Understand:
·       How to reclaim up to 80% of compilation time
·       How to consolidate multiple pieces in the accounting puzzle
·       The difference between automation and compilation
·       What firms are doing to rebalance and retrain their teams ahead of AI
·       The opportunity cost of not implementing a clear AI strategy
Enquiries to jade@zatohq.com. This workshop qualifies for 2.5 CPD hours
Download the Event Programme (PDF)

description:
Advanced/Technique Social Dance Classes, Course 5, Wanting to work on improving your social dance skills and technique? Come to this fun course of open classes, practising drills and exercises to perfect your American Smooth and Rhythm dancing. Classes tailored to accommodate all levels. No partner required.
COURSE: Eight weeks
STARTING: 3 September 2025
TIME: Wednesdays, 8-9pm
PLACE: Level 2, 110 Hutt Rd, Kaiwharawhara, Wellington
COST: $120 per person

description:
Aromatherapy Candle-Making Workshops, To celebrate WOW (World of Wearable Art) season here in Wellington, we're offering two beautiful aromatherapy candle-making workshops, to be held at Wellington Apothecary. These will be held in the afternoon so you can do something fun before the show or before dinner during your stay here in Wellington.

What to expect?
Discover the natural beauty of therapeutic essential oils, learn about scent layering, design your own signature scent and make a clean-burning aromatherapy candle.

When? Friday 19 September, 3pm to 5pm and Friday 3 October, 4pm to 6pm
Where? Wellington Apothecary, Cuba Mall, Wellington

____

What's included in the workshop...

Be guided by Melanie of Poet Botanicals and discover the natural beauty of over 40 pure essential oils
Learn about scent layering and how to create your own essential oil blends at home
Step-by-step guidance on how to make a clean-burning aromatherapy candle
Locally produced refreshments

Investment per person ~ $125. Bookings essential. Suitable for ages 14 years and over. Not recommended if you're pregnant due to the nature of some essential oils.

Please note that your candle will need to cure overnight and will be available for either pickup from Wellington Apothecary or we can courier it to you (cost of courier included in workshop fee). Thank you.

____

Cancellation policy
If you can no longer attend the workshop please contact us at least 72 hours prior for a full refund. If you cancel within 72 hours we can only provide a refund or move you to another date, if we're able to rebook your spot. Thank you.
label: Classes & Workshops

description: Astrophotography Session with the award-winning Chris Murphy, Come along to see award winning shots taken by Chris Murphy of Last Quarter Photography & Under the Stars . Chris is a finalist in the 2025 New Zealand Geographic Photographer of the Year competition and he will share hints and tips on capturing the magic of the dark skies.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Astrophotography Workshop at the Courthouse, Astrophotography Workshop at the Courthouse
Learn how to capture the night sky in this hands-on Astrophotography Workshop, part of Carterton Space Week 2025. Hosted in the historic Courthouse, the evening will feature local and guest astrophotographers, including Sam Leske and Haritina Mogoșanu, with more experts to be announced.

You’ll be guided through the basics of photographing stars, planets, and deep-sky wonders — from camera settings and lenses to composition and editing. If you have a DSLR or mirrorless camera, bring it along for practical tips; if not, come to be inspired and learn how astrophotographers transform the dark Wairarapa skies into works of art.

Audience:

Amateur and aspiring astrophotographers
Stargazers who want to try a new skill
Anyone curious about night sky photography

You may also like the following events from Carterton Space Week:
Next Tuesday, 16th September, 02:30 am, Space Careers Day: Explore Your Future in Clareville
Next Tuesday, 16th September, 08:30 am, Journey Through the Universe: A Space Talk with Sam & Hari in Clareville

description:
BLACK DOG BBQ Masterclass, American Style BBQ Masterclass
20th September 2025
This class will cover everything from meat selection & trimming, fire control, charcoal & wood, the cook, cutting & serving. Along with loads of other tips and trick to upskill your BBQ game leading into summer.
You will be served a six course barbecue meal during the day & we will demonstrate the trim & cook of each protein before serving.
This will include chicken nibbles & chorizo, reverse seared ribeye steaks with chimichurri, pork ribs, sliced smoked brisket & pulled pork tacos.
Finishing with a classic American dessert.
A range of smokers will be fired up during the day, including an Oklahoma Joe Bronco, Traeger Ironwood XL and our massive offset smoker. Alcoholic and other drinks available to purchase during the day.

description:
Balfolk Class - Newtown, Balfolk is a folk dance and music movement from Europe that gives new life to traditional dances. A ‘Bal Folk’ is a social dance event that brings people of all ages and walks of life together through group and partner dances to have fun and connect. It's a friendly, social and energising space.
The class will run over 6 weeks. We will learn and practice different group and partner dances you would commonly find in a Bal Folk.
Dances are simple and easy to learn but also have depth so once you have learnt the basics, we can explore and play around with variations.
Balfolk is accessible to people with all skill levels. You don’t need any previous dance experience, curiosity is all you need
When: Wednesdays from 6:00 to 7:30pm
Location: Newtown Community Centre
Price: $60 for the block of 6 classes
$15/class for casual attendance
Students/concession/unwaged: koha

Have a girls night, bring along your dates, mates, and those you relate to for this local collaboration! This date also coincides perfectly with Father’s Day (7th September)

Come along and make your own bracelet or keychain, and get your first drink (alcoholic or otherwise) on the house. Additional items can be made on the night for $10 each - eftpos payments available.

We’ll bring a huge selection of beads with us, and Abandoned have a huge selection of craft beers, wines, and other delicious drinks to choose between! Snacks available for purchase too.

description:
Brazilian Zouk - Introduction to Tilted turns, Brazilian Zouk - Introduction to Tilted turns
Come and join us for Improvers Zouk Block D (5 weeks).
We have some great new content for you this year and will be building on foundational movements.
The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.

In Improvers Block D you will get an Introduction to Tilted turns as well as some exercises on Floor craft and the Social Dance experience.
===Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week Block cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students
- Ad hoc cost per class is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukImpD
===Location:
Classes are in Studio 6, Level 5, Te Auaha, 65 Dixon Street
===Housekeeping:
- You should have completed the 4 beginner Class blocks before joining Improvers classes
- Drop in or new students, please get in contact before the start of class to let us know you are interested so we can assess your level and organise a private class if necessary to catch you up. description:
Bulgarian Folk Dance Class, Join Bulgarian Ensemble Horo and Discover the Joy of Bulgarian Folk Dance!
No partner? No problem! Our dances are performed in open circles, so everyone is welcome.
Come and experience the vibrant rhythms and rich traditions of Bulgarian music and dance!
Our group regularly performs at multicultural festivals and Bulgarian cultural events around Wellington.
About Our Teacher – Lilia Petrova de Castro:
Lilia began dancing Bulgarian folk at just 8 years old. With 15 years of experience performing across Bulgaria and Europe with Dance Ensemble "Svetlina" and the renowned folk ensemble "Sredetz", she brings deep knowledge and passion to every class. Lilia believes dancing is one of the best ways to energize your body and uplift your mind and she loves sharing that joy with others!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish, Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio. Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece. You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process. Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.
This small group workshop is perfect for absolute beginners—no experience needed. Come solo and meet like-minded creatives, or bring a friend for a fun and mindful morning.
You’ll be amazed at how calming it is to get out of your head and into your hands!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Chain Maille Course, Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.
Course Outline:
Week 01 - 18th September
101: Basic Skills and Discovery
At this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.
Opening & closing rings properly
Trying out some simple structures
Begin exploring material options and how to make your own rings
Homework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille
Week 02 - 25th September
Play and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projects
Playing with recycled & foraged materials
Homework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class
Week 03 - 2nd October
Mathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.
Math of designing chain maille
Theory & pre-planning
Discussion about ideas for individual projects
Identify materials needed to execute individual designs
Homework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.
Week 04 - 16th October
By this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.
Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th October
These classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.
Week 07 - 6th November
At this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.

LOCATION: Greytown Art Gallery
AGES: 8-12 years
COST: $35 (all materials provided)

Children’s “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland – 60 minutes of fun and focused creativity for children aged 8 – 12 years. Immerse your child in a world of colour and creativity with the Under the Sea collage workshop, led by experienced educator Linda Kirkland. Drawing inspiration from the bold, large-scale collages of Henri Matisse—who famously described his technique as painting with scissors—Linda will guide the children through an exciting exploration of shape, colour, and composition. Her engaging teaching style will inspire the young artists to create vibrant and unique masterpieces that bring the underwater world to life.

description:
Clay Creations: Incense Holders, Clay Creations: Incense Holders

Settle in for a cosy evening of creativity, good company, and delicious food.
In this hands-on workshop, everyone will be guided step-by-step to make their own incense holder from air-dry clay — no pottery wheel or kiln needed. The design inspiration for the night will be a dreamy moon-and-stars theme, but there’s plenty of room for personal flair. Those who love to freestyle can create their own unique style, while those who prefer a little direction can simply follow along and enjoy the process.

It’s an easy-going, beginner-friendly space where conversations flow, laughter is encouraged, and there’s something grounding about feeling clay in your hands. It’s a chance to step away from the usual routine, relax into a slower pace, and take joy in making something from scratch.

After the crafting is done, the evening continues with a beautiful plant-based dinner and dessert shared together — wholesome food to round out a wholesome night. Everyone will head home with their own handmade incense holder, a full belly, and that cozy, satisfied feeling that comes from a night spent creating and connecting.

description:
Cooking Classes, Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
For booking a class please contact indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

Just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

This event is a fun, interactive session that gives you the basic skills that could help save a life in the event of a sudden cardiac arrest. You will learn everything you need to know in less than 90 minutes. This includes:
- What to do in an emergency
- How to recognise someone in cardiac arrest and how to perform CPR
- Where to find an AED and how to use it
- About the GoodSAM Responder App.
Knowing CPR means you could save the life of a friend, a colleague, a member of your whānau, or someone on the street.

description:
Glass Bead-Making Taster, Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

description:

This course is a great way for beginners and those with some experience to get into working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways.

Students will learn correct tool use and gain a solid understanding of the lampwork process. They will also learn some ways of incorporating their beads into wearable jewellery with silver and/or stainless-steel findings

Course cost includes set materials, such as glass and stainless-steel findings. Silver, findings and extra glass are available to purchase in the studio.

People under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

description:
Jewellery-making in 4 weeks - Saturday Mornings, Level 2+, This class is for students at level 2 or higher and is not open to beginners. This advanced class is ideal for those who are already competent at soldering simple joins, annealing, and basic tool use on their own. Students must have completed a minimum of two 4-week blocks or one 6-week block. If you are unsure of your level, please contact us for advice.

An advanced set of students means that your tutor can support you to take on more exciting and complex challenges. They will work with the group to find appropriate projects. Each 4-week block may focus on a particular skill topic, rather than covering many different topics for each student.

Level 2 students will learn to solder more competently on their own using chainmaking to develop their fine soldering skills. They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project to hone their skills. Their silver project could be a pendant on a handmade chain, a charm bracelet, or a more complex bezel setting.

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques. They should prepare to have one or two simple, self-directed projects to work on in class.

Please note that this class fee does not include materials. All metals and stones, as well as quality findings and chains, are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it in future projects. If you need to arrange an alternative payment plan, please contact us.

description:
Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // Toi Poneke Art, Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // Toi Poneke Art
After several SOLD OUT workshops in Wellington here is the next one... Oct 2025

Learn the magical art of Kintsugi with Artist Ema Frost in this new Workshop. You can bring along a piece of your own pottery to restore in this beautiful style. (I'll also have a few as back up if you don't have your own piece) (All Levels)

Sunday 12th October - 10:30am - 12:30pm or 2:00 - 4:00pm

Ema has been teaching Kintsugi for 5+ years and regularly travels to Japan to study and learn new techniques. Ema's illustrations and ceramic works sit in many of our countries best galleries, and whose products and merchandise sell in the most stylish design stores and gallery shops. Her style is enchanting - quirky, feminine and colourful, and clearly influenced by her travels throughout the world, usually off the beaten track.

Have you ever wanted to try Kintsugi.... It's an ancient Japanese art form where you fix broken pottery with gold - making its imperfections its beauty. - A truly wonderful philosophy to live by. Nothing is ever really broken but new life and meaning is brought back making your piece a work of art and truly something special. You can also apply this technique on various materials like glass, wood, greenstone and shells.

Kintsugi
It's called kintsugi (金継ぎ), or kintsukuroi (金繕い), literally golden (“kin”) and repair (“tsugi”). This traditional Japanese art uses a precious metal – liquid gold, liquid silver or lacquer dusted with powdered gold – to bring together the pieces of a broken pottery item and at the same time enhance the breaks.

You will take away your wonderful finished work, plus your new skills which will enable you to further your own Kintsugi in your own time.

What you will take away:
A finished artwork piece
A understanding of Kintsugi
Knowledge and History of this beautiful art form.

description:
Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax - Friday Nights, Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun on Friday nights!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
