Calling all fabric lovers, crafters and makers, your favourite fabric market is just around the corner!
When: Saturday 20 September, 10am to 1pm
Where: St Anne's Hall, 22 Emmett St, Newtown (Wellington)
Entry: Free
Come and browse a treasure trove of vintage and modern fabric, patterns, haberdashery and sewing supplies. Whether you are a seasoned sewist, a quilter or just love collecting beautiful textiles, there is something for everyone.
Our café will be open serving tea, coffee and sweet treats to keep your energy up while you shop.
Every stall is different, so it is the perfect chance to snap up unique finds, grab a bargain and stock up your sewing stash while supporting Mary Potter Hospice.
Mark your calendars and tell your crafty friends.
Don’t forget to bring cash and your shopping tote bag for all your bargains.
Select 'Going' on this event to receive reminders and updates.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio, Five years ago we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and sort of watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (also live events a few times a week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving towards present day ~ through a vast richness of hosts, events, music, shows, zines, selectors, connections, pop ups, and story-times. It is a real joy to help community contemporary radio ripple out from this Pacific Island nation to the world wide web.

5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.
Whiro // New Moon. The last dark night of winter. A time for reflection; an invitation to come together as friends and whānau and plant intentional seeds for future flowers to bloom, as well as rest in deep listening and shared beingness.

Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress (duo)
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador


We are also releasing our first ever compilation. This special event will be opened with a premiere listening session of the full CD, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a physical copy at the show, or on bandcamp (preorders open September 1st).
5PM sharp CD push play. Some divine collaborators with unique new releases on offer.

This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling & uplifting one another.

description:
AWE Partnership Masterclass for Violists and Violinists with Yura Lee, Join us for a Masterclass!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge Festival, Orchestra Wellington will host AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee to present a masterclass for violinists and violists in Wellington.
Anyone can register to attend and observe the masterclass!
Visit https://orchestrawellington.co.nz/event/awe-masterclass-2025 to register to attend and observe the masterclass for FREE!
Violinist/violist Yura Lee is a multifaceted musician, as a soloist and as a chamber musician, and one of the very few that is equally virtuosic on both violin and viola. Her career spans three decades and takes her all over the world, captivating audiences through various musical mediums from baroque to modern, and enjoying a career that spans three decades and takes her all over the world. She has performed with major orchestras including those of New York, Chicago, Baltimore, Cleveland, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and given recitals in London’s Wigmore Hall, Vienna’s Musikverein, Salzburg’s Mozarteum, the Palais des BeauxArts in Brussels, and the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam.
At age 12, she became the youngest artist ever to receive the Debut Artist of the Year prize at the Performance Today awards given by National Public Radio. She is the recipient of a 2007 Avery Fisher Career Grant; she has received numerous other international prizes, including top prizes in the Mozart, Indianapolis, Hannover, Kreisler, Bashmet, and Paganini competitions. Yura Lee was the only first prize winner awarded across four categories at the 2013 ARD Competition in Germany.
An Incredible Partnership with At The World's Edge Festival!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge (AWE) Festival, Orchestra Wellington is presenting a three-part series featuring AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee and AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for a mini-series of concerts and a masterclass here in Wellington in addition to featuring these incredible artists' live performances with us on our subscription series concerts in September and October!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Air Force in Concert Featuring Hollie Smith, The Royal New Zealand Air Force (RNZAF) Band is set to blast some big sounds in November. The Wellington-based band joins forces with New Zealand soul singer Hollie Smith. Together, they will take over the Michael Fowler Centre with a diverse repertoire. The RNZAF Band will perform hits from symphonic masterworks and marches to jazz standards and pop classics. Hollie will shine with several of her own famous soul songs. 
Hollie Smith is a prodigious songwriter. She has three number-one solo albums and an abundance of awards under her belt. Fat Freddy’s Drop, Trinity Roots, Anika Moa, and Boh Runga are just a few of her many collaborators. 
The RNZAF Band is a reserve force military band. It regularly welcomes dignitaries at Government House and Parliament, and provides music for commemorations at Pukeahu National War Memorial. Many of its members perform in the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra Wellington, Shapeshifter, and the Rodger Fox Big Band.
Tickets available to the public from 8am on Monday, 8 September.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Album Release | Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra, After receiving glowing international reviews for his debut album ‘Questions in Red’, flamboyant saxophonist / multi-instrumentalist Oscar Lavën is excited to release another exciting album, drawing together a vibrant collection of all-star musicians from various backgrounds under one roof in thrilling new original music, drawing influence from early American swing, blues, classical music, spiritual jazz and 50’s bar-walking rock & roll saxophone.

Prepare to be swept into a surreal cinematic world by the Elegant Calamity Orchestra; strings, woodwinds, brass, virtuosic percussionists and a deep-digging rhythm section, combining kaleidoscopic orchestral colours with the dangerous spontaneity of a small group. A momentous album release not to be missed.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Alex Trask Presents | Coltrane's Soprano, Alex Trask presents a special tribute to John Coltrane, performing tunes that he played on soprano saxophone. ‘Coltrane’s soprano has been hugely influential to me as an alto player and musician. His sound on the instrument is so unique and special, it’s been a touchstone for me for years. I remember being absolutely captivated by his playing on the untitled originals when Both Directions at Once came out, when I was still a beginner player. My Favourite Things is one of my most loved albums, and Everytime We Say Goodbye from that record is some of my favourite saxophone playing ever.’

The band will play classics such as My Favourite Things and Greensleeves, as well as tunes from the albums Both Directions at Once, Duke Ellington & John Coltrane, and Impressions.

Personnel:
Alex Trask – soprano saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
Rick Cranson – drums

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place, Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
Set beneath the exquisite stained-glass windows of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most exquisite landmarks, this series promises an immersive sonic experience that invites audiences to explore sound in a deeply personal and transformative way.
Altared States is inspired by Brian Sweeney’s New York-founded Ambient Church, an initiative dedicated to collaborating with artists to create transformative audio performances in architecturally significant spaces. This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists. The series lineup includes:
August 1: Ludus
August 8: Stephen Gallagher with David Long and Jules Desmond
August 15: Oghum
August 22: Dream Chambers
Set within the chancel at the altar of the venue, each artist will perform a 60-minute immersive sound experience that redefines ritual in a contemporary light.
Tickets are available from Wednesday 18 June, with limited capacity of 50 for each show of this intimate series.
About the Artists
Ludus
is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard. Her creative inspiration spans across the worlds of electronic music, audio engineering, sound design, and the written word. Bernard’s artistic journey explores the deep connection between soundscapes and the natural world, with a focus on evoking emotional responses to the environments we inhabit. She is also co-founder of the Pōneke-based collective Tonic.
Stephen Gallagher
is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance. Most recently, he completed the score for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, directed by Kenji Kamiyama. Gallagher’s work spans collaborations with Peter Jackson, Brian Eno, Ed Sheeran, Nick Cave, and many more.
David Long
is a composer, performer, founding member of The Mutton Birds, and member of easy listening noise band, Teeth. His career has spanned over 40 years and seen him work on numerous projects to commercial and critical acclaim. In his own words he likes to “mash shit up”, creating orchestral scores that utilise “not only classical instruments but all sorts of things”.
Jules Desmond
is an experimental musician from Wellington who has played in bands including Letterbox Lambs, 1/3 Octave Band, Bachelor of Architecture and Black Boned Angel.
Oghum
is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.
Jess Chambers
is a composer, musician, and educator currently based in Aotearoa New Zealand, and working under the moniker Dream Chambers. From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling. It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.”
The Pyramid Club, located on Taranaki Street, is an artist-run space dedicated to experimental music and sonic arts, providing a home for innovative sound exploration.

Romantic love, sacred love, and even friendship will be captured through the works of Tallis, Ireland, Whitacre, and the shimmering centrepiece of Lauridsen's Nocturnes. New works by Wellington's own Jonathan Berkahn sit alongside a vibrant selection of madrigals that capture the joy, longing, and playful spirit that love inspires.

description:
Antipodes, Antipodes is a quintet of musicians from Sydney and Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington that playfully moves between the arty/cerebral and the folksy/earthy elements of jazz and improvised music. Sometimes delicate and considered, sometimes brawny and muscular, the intent that brings their performances together is a commitment to the song: each composition is a glistening artefact, brought to dynamic life by the ensemble.

Originally formed in Berlin and drawing influences from New York to Stockholm, Antipodes has, over 10 years of touring and recording, forged their own identity: a unique triptych of North American, Northern European, and South Pacific sounds that captivates audiences, offering them a shared journey into their dreamlike and evocative co-creations.

Featuring:

Jake Baxendale (saxophone)
Callum Allardice (guitar)
Luke Sweeting (piano)
Tom Botting (bass)
Tim Geldens (drums)

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

description:
Antu Marama, The Undercurrent presents Antu Marama!

Wellington band Antü Mārama brings you the vibrant evocative folk music of Latin America, with traditional tunes and original compositions. From Chile, the UK, New Zealand and the Canary Islands the group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mapudungún word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.

The group combines both the life-giving energy and vitality of the sun with the deeper emotions and more reflective energy of the Moon. Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.

Watch them perform here:
https://www.instagram.com/reel/DHcrQc2Rf0O/?igsh=bGV5cHdpeTVqMzB2⁩

Saturday 6th September
Doors 7pm/ Gig 7:30pm
$15
Tickets available online and on the door

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

See you there!

description:
Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra - The Nutcracker Suite tickets, Witness a defining moment in this country’s jazz scene as the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra (AoJO) makes its highly anticipated debut at Meow Nui.
Born from a collective vision championed and inspired by jazz legend Rodger Fox, AoJO represents the shared aspirations of the jazz community – honouring our jazz lineage while serving as a platform for its future. This newly formed, and proudly national ensemble brings our country’s jazz talent and legacy into focus.
Led by Musical Director John Rae and Concert Master Oscar Lavën, with Mike Taylor (lead trumpet) and Kaito Walley (lead trombone), this concert features Duke Ellington and Billy Strayhorn’s vibrant reimagining of Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker Suite. A groundbreaking fusion of classical and jazz, it’s hailed as one of Ellington’s most inventive works. Together Strayhorn and Ellington showcase the familiar themes of Tchaikovsky’s ballet through the expressive power of jazz in orchestral form.
Prepare to be captivated by lush orchestration and melodic innovation as the AoJO takes to the stage for the very first time.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Aunty Records Presents: Jazmine Nikitta [AUS] with Benny Salvador, Aunty Records Presents: Jazmine Nikitta [AUS] with Benny Salvador
Caribbean-Australian DJ Jazmine Nikitta is one of the most exciting names in global dance music right now. Fresh off her first world tour, she supported SiR across Europe and headlined parties across North and South America. She’s shared the stage with Brent Faiyaz, Bryson Tiller, Davido, Tems, and became the first Australian DJ to tour with Soulection, performing across Miami and Jamaica. Festival highlights include Splendour in the Grass, Dark MOFO, and a headline slot at Promiseland between Ms. Lauryn Hill and Tems.


Beyond the decks, Jazmine served as Spotify AUNZ’s exclusive Hip-Hop and R&B Editor (2021–24), launching Australia’s first Afrobeats and Amapiano playlist, Afro Fusion, and curating the platform’s biggest local dance playlists. She also hosted A1 The Show, a Spotify-exclusive podcast, interviewing artists like Uncle Waffles, Central Cee, and Saweetie.


She’s joined by Wellington’s Benny Salvador — DJ, producer, multi-instrumentalist, and one of New Zealand’s most exciting young talents. Benny’s eclectic sets blend house, techno, disco-funk, dub, and electro, with releases on Rush Hour, Racquet Club, Juke Bounce Werk, and his own Aunty Records.


Support from Awa.

description:
Aunty Records Presents: Mark Farina [USA] with Benny Salvador, Aunty Records Presents: Mark Farina [USA] with Benny Salvador
Get ready, Wellington—one of the most influential figures in house music is landing in the capital for a night of deep grooves, soulful rhythms, and undeniable dancefloor magic at Meow NUI.

===Tickets on sale Friday 22 August at 12.00PM====

Mark Farina is a global dance music icon whose name resonates across the scene. Known for his Mushroom Jazz series, deep house sets, and marathon all-night performances, Farina has built a career on innovation, consistency, and a relentless touring schedule of over 100 shows a year. He has collaborated with legendary venues and record labels, showcasing both classic and new school producers in his sets.

With his recent YouTube series with Defected Records and continued worldwide performances, Farina connects with both longtime fans and new audiences alike, delivering unforgettable journeys through house, jazz-infused grooves, and eclectic beats.

Supporting him is Wellington’s Benny Salvador — one of New Zealand’s most exciting young talents. A DJ, producer, multi-instrumentalist, radio host, and event promoter, Benny has shared stages with Marcellus Pittman and Courtesy and played major festivals including Splore, Beacon, and Catacombs. He has recorded mixes for Planet Trip Records, NTS, Balamii, Related Articles, and Friendly Potential Radio, and released music on Racquet Club, Rush Hour, Love Above Records, Juke Bounce Werk, and his own Aunty Records. Benny’s eclectic sets blend house, techno, disco-funk, dub, and electro, drawing on jazz and funk influences while showcasing his crate-digging, collaborative approach.

This is a rare chance to experience two generations of dance music mastery under one roof. From Farina’s world-renowned grooves to Benny’s forward-thinking, genre-spanning sets, the night promises a journey through sound that will move the floor and leave a lasting impression. For fans of house, jazz-infused beats, and cutting-edge underground sounds, this is a must-attend event at Meow Nui.

Saturday 18th October
Doors 9:30 PM

You may also like the following events from meow NUI:
Next month, 17th October, 12:00 pm, Yoko-Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA in Wellington

description:
BANDIT QUEEN @ The Boathouse, Nelson, BANDIT QUEEN is NZ's finest (likely only) tribute to the music of The Decemberists.A Tribute to the Decemberists? BUT WHO ARE THE DECEMBERISTS?
Hailing from Portland Oregon, The Decemberists is an indie-alt folk rock band that write epic songs and have 9 studio albums to their credit. They are renowned for their musical style and unique storytelling with many song lyrics based on historical incidents and folklore. Perhaps drawing musical influence from the likes of The Beatles, Tom Waits, REM, Morrisey, their songs are exquisitely constructed and effortlessly combine folk-rock with elements of pop creating the infectious sound that is The Decemberists.
And who is BANDIT QUEEN? Experienced Christchurch based musos - Tim Kent (vocals, acoustic guitar); Justin 'Rusty' White (lead guitar); Jo-Anne Davern Fuller (vocals, keyboard); Chiara Lowe (violin, vocals); Adam Lowe (bass); Mark Newburn (drums, percussion).
The members of BANDIT QUEEN are passionate about this project and invite you to come experience and enjoy the eclectic music of USA indie-rock band THE DECEMBERISTS.

Bill Hickman, Cindy Muggeridge & Neil Billington play Hilltop, First Set; Bill Hickman - Opening the show is Wellington singer-songwriter Bill Hickman, known for his strong gravel dragged voice, driving guitar work, and honest, well-crafted songs. Blending folk, country and roots influences, Bill’s set moves between grit and tenderness, with stories of outlaws, love, and life hard-lived.

Second Set; Cindy Muggeridge & Neil Billington - The second part of this special show features the queen of the blues and boogie piano, Cindy Muggeridge, together with the firebrand of the blues harp, Neil Billington, performing their own unique brand of blues, boogies and ballads.

Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30

Teas, coffee and snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays and all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

description:
Bill Lake's Slow Bake, The Undercurrent presents Bill Lake's Slow Bake!

Join us for a night of swinging blues!

Guitarist, singer and songwriter Bill Lake is one of New Zealand’s most respected and long-serving practitioners. For more than four decades the singer and guitarist led the iconic country-blues band The Windy City Strugglers, as well as playing with pioneering rock group Mammal in the 70s and fronting brassy funk-rockers The Pelicans in the 80s. His songs have been covered by Midge Marsden, Darren Watson, Kokomo, Rag Poets and Marg Layton.
Bassist Steve Hemmens played with Bill in Mammal. Recently returned from many years in the UK, he adds warmth and swing to the mix.
Long time popular musician Alan Norman plays percussion, accordion, guitar and occasional piano. He is a member of both NZ’s seminal Country band The Warratahs, and Wellington band Rag Poets.

Sunday 14th September
Doors 5pm/ Gig 5:30pm
$15
Tickets available online and on the door

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

description:
Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton in concert, Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton in concert
DATE: Saturday Sept 27
TIME: 7pm
LOCATION: The Offering – 65 Main St, Greytown
AGES:
COST: $25 pp at the door or booking link below

Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton are two of New Zealand’s best-known folk musicians. They bring their deep musical connection to festivals across New Zealand, playing their favourite songs and tunes collected over years of playing together at festivals, stages and late into the night at kitchen tables. Based in Wellington, Bob is one of NZ’s best-known folk songwriters and a favourite with Greytown audiences. His songs have been covered by artists in NZ, Australia, the UK and the USA. New Zealand Musician magazine compared his songwriting to Bruce Springsteen and Mark Knopfler; the Dominion Post likened him to Jackson Brown, James Taylor, Luka Bloom and Dougie Ma¬cLean. A guitarist, he is known for his distinctive open-tuned acoustic fingerstyle and electric guitar playing. He has toured widely in NZ, Australia, Canada, Ireland, the UK and the USA. His latest album, released in June 2024, is Lost Stars, an extended release on CD and download featuring new recordings and rarities, with Emily on violin and piano.

From Whangarei, Emily is a virtuoso violinist inspired by the Scottish tradition and the modern trad movement. Classically trained, she is infinitely adaptable with her gorgeous stylings and fiery tune playing, making her the perfect foil for Bob’s lyrical songs.

Don’t miss a chance to see these two consummate musicians share their foot-stomping collection of banging tunes, favourite songs and stolen moments from the last 20 years.

Book your tickets here:
https://greytownarttown.com/bob-mcneill-and-emily-roughton-in-concert/

description:
BØLZER - Southern Tempest Tour: Wellington - This week, BØLZER [bœlˈtsr] ~ He who strikes like lightning – with sudden, decisive force or implications.
BØLZER - SOUTHERN TEMPEST TOUR
20/08 - Wellington; Valhalla
21/08 - Auckland; Whammy Bar
Tickets on sale from: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/97050/BLZER.utr
An intuitive art project born from raw passion;
musical ecstasy fueled by impulsive composition
and enactment. Whilst wielding a lyrical and musical
medium largely inspired by – and seeking to
channel – the primeval essence of the human experience,
flashes of illumination will descend the sky
from which there shall be no shelter.
Forged of an intense understanding between drummer
Fabian Wyrsch and guitarist Okoi Jones, the
project first took physical form in 2008. Before
long, the dualistic significance of their musical partnership
outshone any need for a bass player and
has since served to both challenge and empower the
band’s creativity. Following their 2010 live debut in
Zürich, BØLZER soon made a name for themselves
as the remarkable Swiss-Antipodean duo capable of
conjuring up mighty barriers of sound with nothing
but a ten-stringed guitar and an almost ritualistic
percussion style. The pair describe their own stage
experience as a form of spiritual rapture, an atavistic
vortex woven together from the profound union
of spectacle meeting spectator on a deeper plane.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series From Scratch, New Zealand’s oldest and most avant-garde chamber music ensemble, From Scratch, has been performing nationally and internationally since 1974, principally under the leadership of sound and intermedia artist Phil Dadson.

From Scratch have developed an original and innovative sound/performance style that includes large sculptural invented instruments (primarily percussion), and innovative hocket-style rhythms – where the performers’ individual parts interlock to create complex rhythmic and melodic structures.

The current collective core-group consists of Adrian Croucher, Shane Currey, Phil Dadson, Darryn Harkness and Chris O'Connor.
label: Music & Concerts

is set to bring their unmistakable energy back to local stages.
Since their last performances in New Zealand, CKF has continued to push musical boundaries, earning Billboard chart success with tracks like “Churn” and “Nothing at All.”
Their latest EP, Dream Season, showcases the band's ever-evolving sound—fusing intricate live looping,
intense rhythms, and ambient textures. This homecoming is more than a tour—it’s a full-circle moment for one of NZ’s most innovative exports.
Joining CKF at Meow will be Wellington based Sheeps. Described as Art Rock for the end times, Sheeps are definitely the right band at the right time to partner CKF in 2025.
Don’t miss the return of Cairo Knife Fight. It’s been a long time coming.

Soak up the weekend vibes with an afternoon of live music from award-winning duo Cam & Sam. Known for their powerhouse vocals, dazzling piano skills, and infectious energy, these two deliver a show packed with classics, singalongs, and feel-good favourites.
From Elton John and Fleetwood Mac to Ed Sheeran, Bruno Mars, and Queen, Cam & Sam bring decades of hits to life — the perfect soundtrack to a Sunday session by the water.
Classic Vibes • Party Anthems • Big Energy
Great Drinks • Waterfront weekend vibes • Free Entry
Kick back, sing along, and let Cam & Sam light up your Sunday afternoon!

www.camandsam.co.nz

description:
Capital Blues Presents: Jess and Cam, Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.
She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.
Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.
Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.
10% discount at the bar for food and drinks for members.

description:
Carmichael: the September Edition, The first Carmichael appearance of spring, and you’re invited! Heralding baby lambs, blossoming daffodils, and iced oat lattes, Carmichael is back to play some more music and have even more fun.

Carmichael is a six-piece jazz ensemble, based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Born from the darkest depths of jazz school, Carmichael was formed by a bunch of friends to make music that’s danceable as heck and have a good time doing it together.
Inspired by different global groove-driven collectives, such as Kokoroko, Ezra Collective, Nubiyan Twist & Fat Freddy’s Drop, their music blends elements of afrobeat, neo-soul and jazz fusion.

Featuring the beloved Carmichaelians :
Lily Atu - alto saxophone & vocals
Elisa Bird - baritone saxophone
Frank Paton - trumpet
Darcy Monteath - bass
Petar Tavich - guitar
Joseph Alexander - drums

Nearing a decade of sold-out tours across the country, The Butlers' trademarked infectious energy and presence within the room simply can’t be missed!

description:
Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour, Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour
Indie-Folk Artist Colette Rivers and her band will be performing her intimate new album, The Backyard Wonder.

Independent artist Colette Rivers is releasing her second full-length album, The Backyard Wonder, an intimate exploration of healing, change, and the quiet beauty of ordinary moments.

This album holds special meaning for Rivers: after being diagnosed with cancer in July 2023, her planned sophomore release had to take a back seat to recovery. But when the cancer returned in early 2025, she felt compelled to finish and release the album, not just as a legacy project, also as a celebration after hard times, with a focus on how “you can find the wonder in life, even in your backyard.”

A lifelong creative, Rivers records, mixes, and produces in her home studio in Masterton, and plays every instrument heard on The Backyard Wonder. Her debut album, Memory Lake (2020), was shaped by early years spent in the US, and her move to Taupō at age 11; this was followed by a nationwide tour. Now based in the Wairarapa and working as a secondary school drama teacher, Rivers continues to move between solo performance and full band sets, while staying rooted in the acoustic traditions that define her sound.

With her right arm partially paralysed following recent treatment, Rivers has gathered a group of close friends to help bring the songs of The Backyard Wonder to life (especially its intricate fingerpicking parts) for a run of live shows. She’ll be touring the Wellington and Wairarapa regions from August through October, finishing with a set at the Wellington Folk Festival.

Opening for Rivers is Beans:

Beans is a recent fixture in the Pōneke folk scene, importing a wild array of original songs and generally embodying the classic singer songwriter formula – introvert plus guitar. They are one third of folk trio 'Don & the Divorcees', but are known for solo shows which are rich with humour, honesty and interesting word choices. Expect to feel things.


You may also like the following events from Colette Rivers:

Location:The Long Hall is a hidden gem - the intimate venue with the best view in Wellington! Couches, chairs, cushions… you choose your comfort level. description:
Daniel Champagne (Australia) LIVE at Martinborough Town Hall (7pm Show), Show #1 - SOLD OUT
Second show announced by popular demand!
The young virtuoso recently described as “the finest guitar player of this generation” has spent the past few years selling out shows all over the globe and will be bringing his dynamite live act back to New Zealand in 2025 for a series of intimate regional concerts!
Seated show
Family friendly  
Cheaper $15 tickets for under 18s because live music is for everyone!
BYO (non alcoholic) drinks and nibbles 
October 19, 2025 @ Martinborough Town Hall
Doors open from 6:30pm / show starts at 7:00pm (8:10pm finish) 
Tickets are VERY limited. DON'T miss out!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY..
“The word Prodigy seems to entirely fall short of this soft-spoken young man’s skills, he coaxes sounds and melodies out of his instrument that literally drop jaws.”
The Calgary Herald, CANADA

“Today I saw the future of Folk – Festival goers flocking in the thousands towards the main stage to witness a young musical phenomenon from Australia dish out an absolute show-stopper.” The Firefly Column, USA

“Daniel Champagne is a crossroads. Fusing the strong traditions of Blues, Folk and other roots art with pop showmanship and admirable lyrical ability. I firmly believe that he will become an ambassador for roots music in a time where it desperately needs representation.” The Indie Blender, CANADA

“reinventing roots guitar” Rhythms Magazine, AUSTRALIA“Watching Daniel Champagne perform is a once in a lifetime experience. He is a true prodigy that plays like no one else could possibly play unless they spent at least two lifetimes studying the art.” BW Review, NEW ZEALAND

“Daniel Champagne exudes a natural ease on stage, as he sings poignant lyrics and beautifully crafted melodies that invariably whisk the heart up with grand romanticism. Coupled with an exhilarating guitar talent that transcends mere acoustic playing to replicate a whole band, Champagne is just magical” Themusic.com.au, AUSTRALIA

"You feel as if he just invented the instrument yesterday and was discovering its possibilities afresh” Ted Gioia (American jazz critic and music historian)

description:
Debt Club EP Release Show W/ Model Home & Wiri Donna, Debt Club celebrate the release of their debut EP “Taste For Stout” with a special show in Pōneke, joined by friends and powerhouse live acts Model Home and Wiri Donna.
Formed in 2023, Debt Club have quickly made their mark with a dynamic, guitar-driven sound that blends anthemic hooks with thoughtful lyricism. Following the release of singles “Little Lines” and “Windows,” both featured on “Taste For Stout”, the band are set to mark this milestone with their biggest show yet.
Ōtautahi legends Model Home bring their kiwi take on midwest emo, earning massive attention with their 2023 debut album “…And Nobody Made A Sound” and a bunch of student radio hits.
Wiri Donna, led by Bianca Bailey, are a commanding indie rock force whose high energy shows and acclaimed EP’s Being Alone and In My Chambers have made them one of Aotearoa’s most exciting live acts.

description:
Donál Gunning, Every Wednesday, come down to Moon for FREE live music from 6.30pm, all pizzas $15 from 5.30-9pm

Dónal Gunning is a singer songwriter from Dublin, Ireland. He draws on rock, folk, indie and punk influences.

Now based in Wellington, New Zealand his debut solo single Homesick released in October 2023. Homesick is a song dedicated to the masses who have emigrated their motherland for opportunity and adventure. It tells the story of the struggle in leaving friends and family.

His debut EP Born to Perform released in May 2024. The EP was inspired and written while travelling New Zealand, Portugal and Ireland.

Donal has released two singles in 2025 Your 1 & Losing Weight both of which have received tremendous praise globally. He is set to release a second EP later this year. He knows how to work the crowd and always brings fun, energy and Irish charm through his thought-provoking lyrics and formative sound

description:
Echoes of Home: A Musical Journey Across Time, Event Information
Some days remind us who we are and where we come from — when an entire nation moves as one to honour Independence.
To celebrate the 80th Anniversary of Vietnam’s National Day (2 September), Viet Hub NZ proudly presents
“Echoes of Home – A Musical Across Time”
This free concert is a heartfelt journey through the sounds of Vietnamese history — from nostalgic childhood songs to powerful wartime ballads and modern melodies of pride and hope. All performances will include English subtitles, making it easy for everyone to follow along and connect with the stories.
Whether you’re Vietnamese or simply curious about a different culture, this is a wonderful opportunity to experience the warmth, resilience, and beauty of Vietnam through music and storytelling.
🎁 Raffle with Over $300 in Prizes
Don’t miss our special raffle on the day. Tickets will be available at the venue for $5 and $10. Payment can be made in cash or by bank transfer.
💛 Support Viet Hub NZ
This event is free to attend, but if you believe in what we do and want to help us continue running community workshops, cultural events, and youth-led initiatives — please consider making a donation.
👉 Donate here: https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/viet-hub-nz-rooted-in-culture-powered-by-community
Your koha helps keep our work going, rooted in culture, powered by community.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Echoes of Us - WJF 2025, Echoes of Us is a live, improvised music experience where you are the muse. In an evening of deep reflection, spontaneous creativity and genuine musicianship, a house band fronted by saxophonist and woodwind doubler Zoe Ioannou, invites you as the audience to share personal moments, memories, or themes—light-hearted, emotional, joyful, tender–anything you desire. These offerings are then to be transformed into rich, evolving soundscapes created in real-time by the musicians. Perfectly set in the warm, intimate and light atmosphere of Whisky and Wood, this event offers an invitation to slow down, listen deeply, and feel heard in a way words alone often cannot achieve. Come as you are—your story may become the music that moves and echoes us all at Wellington Jazz Festival 2025.
Doors open 4.30pm for a 5pm start.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington, 🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington – Launch Event ✨🌟
With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn, Wellington
Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to bring Ecstatic Dance Wellington to life! 🎉 This is the launch event, and we can’t wait to co-create the first of many transformational dance journeys with you.
💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.
🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, weaves deep bass, tribal rhythms, and world sounds into journeys that move both body and soul. With over 8 years of Ecstatic Dance DJing experience, a DJ Teacher, and 24 years as a DJ - Kimba creates alchemical spaces of release, joy, and transformation. Originally from Auckland, she ran Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years & runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival. She is excited to bring her skills to the dance floor!
🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn, Wellington
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Sound & closing with Bernie
🎟 Tickets
$25 online
$30 cash on the door
❤️ What to Bring
Socks (floor can be cool)
Yoga mat, cushion, or blanket if you’d like to rest
Loose, comfy clothes
Warm layers for afterwards
A friend!
🌟 Guidelines
Drug & alcohol free
No talking on the dance floor
No phones/cameras
Respect the space & each other
🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/
✨ Come help us launch Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

description:
First Reserve, Dropper & Elly Mae, Get ready for another memorable night out as First Reserve & Dropper share the bill with rising star Elly Mae. This will be an evening to feast your ears on a diverse soundscape of angular guitars, melodic goodness, and glorious noise.

Here’s the lo-down:

First Reserve is inevitable. Before adopting the moniker in 2023, Ryan Connaghan had been prolifically writing music that communicated their experiences in life, love, and loneliness. These themes are all approached on songs like “Last One” and “Me & My Friends” – the first offerings from First Reserve’s debut EP set for release in late 2025. On stage, their sound is both intimate and larger-than-life, combining influences from alt-rock, indie-folk, and pop.

Dropper combines intuitive songwriting sensibilities with wall-of-sound, guitar.  Blending noise and melody, Dropper is dynamic, song-centred, high-energy indie rock. Often compared to Bob Mould’s work with Hüsker Dü or Lou Barlow's early Sebadoh, they’ve been described by one review as having a "high energy stage performance punctuated by flawless musicianship and songwriting skills that seems beyond the years...Honestly, it’s hard to overstate how impressed I was with Dropper and am eagerly awaiting my next chance to see them live.”

Elly Mae's music encapsulates the bittersweet complexities of growth, relationships, time escaping, and the nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, shoegaze and whatnot.

Grab your general release tickets online for just $15! Or, even better, grab an early bird ticket for only $10 and secure your spot for a night of unforgettable live music. Doors at 8pm, first act on at 8:30pm.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Folk B*tch Trio - Wellington, Folk Bitch Trio - 'Now Would Be A Good Time' Album Tour with special guest Georgia Knight

Now Would Be A Good Time, the debut album by Folk Bitch Trio, tells vivid, visceral stories. Their music sounds familiar, and it’s built on a foundation of the music they’ve loved throughout their lives–gnarled Americana, classic rock, piquant, clear-eyed balladry. But the songs are modern, youthful, singing acutely through dissociative daydreams and galling breakups, sexual fantasies and media overload, all the petty resentments and minor humiliations of being in your early twenties in the 2020s.

Heide Peverelle (they/them), Jeanie Pilkington (she/her) and Gracie Sinclair (she/her) have known each other since high school, and first started singing together five years ago. Peverelle recalls sending Pilkington a heartbroken—in their words “bad”—song they had written called “Edie”; Pilkington remembers the song differently. “I felt so inspired that my teenage peer had written something so honest and original,” she recalls. It wasn’t long before she messaged Peverelle and Sinclair, asking if they’d be interested in starting a “folk bitch trio.” As soon as they started singing together, their connection deepened, and “the chemistry of being inspired by each other was evident from the get-go,” says Sinclair.

Listening to Folk Bitch Trio, it’s clear that this is a band of three distinct points of view, with contrasting and complementary backgrounds and visions. Pilkington grew up with two musician parents and brings formative memories of watching them perform, of listening to Gillian Welch and Lucinda Williams, and of her own imagined path as a career musician. Peverelle spends their spare time making art and furniture; those hobbies, as well as their love of pop music old and new, articulate a love for the tactile, the home-grown and the hand-made. Sinclair is the self-proclaimed jester of the group, but her taste skews dark, gothic, baroque and dramatic, expressed as a love of opera and ballet as well as musicians as wide-ranging as Patti Smith, Nirvana and Tchaikovsky.

Folk music has a bad habit of being presented as a deathly serious concern. It’s the music you cry to, it’s overly sacred, it’s solemnly considered by critic-historians. But Folk Bitch Trio have a shared sense of humour that is embedded deep in their music and that sets it alight, safe from the self-serious traps of the genre. Now Would Be A Good Time is funny and darkly ironic in the manner of writers like Mary Gaitskill or Otessa Moshfegh. On “Gods A Different Sword” they crack that “My body keeps the score/But if you tell me that you need it/I can get up off my floor,” a nod to the clichéd, over-referenced millennial self-help book, as they wryly sing about sex within earshot of housemates, and wring sexual innuendo from physics terminology

Join us at The Runholder for a late afternoon jazz concert with The Sunflowers Jazz Trio from Wellington.

Inspired by legends like Anita O’Day and Sarah Vaughan, The Sunflowers bring timeless jazz classics to life on the guitar, vocals & double bass, delivering renditions from the Great American Songbook with style, soul & swing.

description:
Funky Fridays Vol. 7 - Not My Sister, Libby K, Ben-Jammin, We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 7!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Libby K, Ben-Jammin & our host Not My Sister!
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.
Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11.30 Libby K
11.30-1 Ben Jammin
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------
NOT MY SISTER
Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington, she started this project in 2024, and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand, you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency, Kiwiburn, Earthbeat, Cuba Dupa, Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco, with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy, Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist, she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines, blending soulful, tech, garage, and deep house sounds.
www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
www.facebook.com/notmysista

www.instangram.com/not.my.sister

LIBBY K
From the vibrant streets of Wellington, Libby's fascination with music began at an early age with the smooth sultry
sounds of the clarinet and piano. Fast forward to her 20s where she stumbled into the hypnotic world of techno in
Berlin and a passion for 4/4 was ignited.
With a deep appreciation for the power of music to transform, Libby finds the greatest joy on a dance floor, where
the magic of music brings people together and gives us the freedom to be ourselves. Her sets are filled with
uplifting, emotive and tantalising sounds of downtempo, house and techno. Mixed with intention and a whole lot
of love xx
https://soundcloud.com/libby_k
https://www.instagram.com/libbykdj/
https://www.facebook.com/libbykmusic

https://www.twitch.tv/libbykdj
BEN-JAMMIN
Originally from Bristol, UK, Ben was immersed in soundsystem culture from an early age. He started collecting vinyl in his teens and developed a passion for the heavier side of electronic music. With his formative years spent mixing vinyl, studying African percussion and playing drums and recording for rock/rap group Band of Crooks, he moved on to play with some of the best underground DJ's, producers and musicians in Aotearoa, Australia and UK. Ben has played a myriad of parties and events including Newtown Festival, Cuba Dupa, Kiwi Burn, Little Monsters, Insomnia, Toots Suite Festival (Salmonella Dub, Laughton Kora, Pheonix Foundation), Breakaway Magical Doof Bus (Paige Julia, Y, Sorchalula,Young Gho$t, House MD), Cuba Dupa, Sydney Rd Street Festival (Melbourne), Cafe Blue (UK), Castros (UK).
Ben-Jammin can do what is needed to keep a dancefloor alive, comfortably switching between genres to suit the mood.
Always armed with bags of bass heavy treats expect a selection of new, classic and surprise music to help you release your spirit into the world.
https://soundcloud.com/ben_young_2000
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Funky Mama, They're back!

nky Mama has been a staple in the Wellington music diet since it's inception in 2016. They bring a unique sound that's influenced by deep funk, bouncy boogaloo & 80's house featuring silly & poignant originals penned by Bryn van Vliet.

Bryn van Vliet - Saxophone, Vocals
Kaito Walley - Tbone
Petar Tavich - Guitar

description:
GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, Eyegum Music Collective presents GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, a multi-venue music and arts festival taking over Pōneke's Cuba Street precinct for one night only on Saturday 6 September 2025. Showcasing 40 of Aotearoa's best artists across 10 neighbouring venues, this is one big party you shouldn't miss.
Eyegum has worked hard to curate a programme that is sure to offer something for everyone, from first time gig-goers to seasoned live music obsessives. The eclectic lineup includes perennial indie maestros The Bats, capital hometown heroes The Phoenix Foundation, hip hop superstar JessB, troubadour-turned-party starter Anthonie Tonnon, captivating genre-bender Reb Fountain, the incredible local-by-way-of-Naarm Jen Cloher, plus a selection of up-and-coming artists handpicked from Eyegum's Free Wednesday weekly showcase series, and everything in between. There will also be plenty more to be announced soon including more music, poetry, live-scored cinema, and a travelling DJ stage curated by Tonic Collective.

description:
Girls Rock the Boys (Wellington), Girls Rock the Boys is bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage. With Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, Jude Madill, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, and a stellar band backing them up, it's bound to be a night of high-energy performances.

This from our last gig...

"Man did they ROCK! 4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking - check them out!"

An electrifying time warp! The 70s were a golden era for rock, with bands like Journey, Led Zeppelin, Whitesnake, and Deep Purple defining the sound of an entire generation. The idea of powerhouse female vocalists fronting a live band, belting out classics from these legends, is pure magic.

Early bird tickets are just $20, while door sales are $30—so it's definitely worth grabbing them early. This show is going to be an absolute blast, so securing those cheaper tickets ahead of time is a smart move.

description:
Greg Crayford's Jazz Night - Twenty Year Anniversary!, Twenty years! Yep, you read that right. This residency has run for two solid decades.
Greg Crayford here. Host and drummer of what’s been billed for some time now as Wellington’s Longest-Running Jazz Residency. And rightly so! Little could we have known when this gig began at The Realm in Hataitai in August 2005 that it’d still be going in 2025. It’s a fantastic achievement. Longer residencies have occurred in our town but nothing currently running holds a candle to that sort of effort by a single artist, at a single venue, in this town (and possibly beyond).
We boast quite the legacy: two Tui-nominated live albums, several bar owners, many managers and staff, hundreds of featured professional musicians and young artists, 500-odd gigs, uncountable numbers of pizzas, beer, whisky, and much laughter and joy. From local music students to top-notch international artists we’ve seen it all.
It’s a huge milestone - 20 years of high quality music played by a massive variety of talented people.
The exciting programme is largely finalised and is pasted below.
Mark the date!
Table bookings 04 974 2207 or info.therealm@nzvenueco.nz or therealm.co.nz and click on ‘book a table’
Great ambience, good company, superb kai and stellar music. What more could a jazz fan want? How about twenty years of quality music?
Sure hope to see you there

description:
Gregory Alan Isakov,   American indie-folk artist Gregory Alan Isakov is a Grammy-nominated singer and songwriter. He’s bringing his intimate and lyric-driven show to Wellington in February. Audiences will be given a special opportunity to experience stripped-down acoustic arrangements. He’ll delve into favourites from six of his full-length studio albums, including his most recent ‘Appaloosa Bones’. 
This 2023 album was praised with an Associated Press reviewer saying, “His new songs are relentlessly majestic, a kind of musical morphine”. Gregory has amassed a devoted community of fans who have helped him garner over 1 billion streams on listening platforms to date.
label: Music & Concerts

description: Heaven & Earth: Celebrating 25 Years of Bold Sounds, Heaven & Earth marks 25 years of Stroma’s fearless exploration of sound and spirit since our inaugural concert Wind, Rain & Light in August 2000. We recall the theme of that first concert by similarly evoking musical impressions of the earth below and the sky above. Featuring a world premiere by New York-based NZ composer Leila Adu-Gilmore, the programme includes Olivier Messiaen’s ecstatic Louange à l’immortalité de Jésus, Gemma Peacocke’s Sky Fields, John Rimmer’s Where Sea Meets Sky 2, Michael Norris’s new piano trio The Spaces In Between, and—to mark the recent passing of Sofia Gubaidulina—her meditative Garden of Joy and Sorrow. Come join us in celebrating a quarter century of intrepid sonic exploration from the musicians of Stroma.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Hobnail at Kapiti Playhouse, Hobnail are celebrating the release of their new album "Three Part" with a national tour. “Three Part” (out July 2025) is the 8th album from Wellington’s Hobnail. The new album features Hobnail’s take on songs by some of their favourite Kiwi and Australian bands and songwriters, including Don McGlashan, Barry Saunders, the Waifs, Nick Cave, and more.. These versions highlight the vocal and instrumental interplay between these 3 exceptional musicians.
Hobnail are a Wellington institution. They have played shows everywhere from Pittsburgh to Paekakariki, New Plymouth to Norfolk Island, Auckland to Amsterdam, Germany to Gore, the Canadian Praries to the Canterbury Plains. They are 3-time finalists at the New Zealand Music Awards (Best Folk Album and Best Country Song twice).
"Refreshingly down-to-earth and lovely with vocals so tightly knit they could be family"

Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. description: Illicit Love, Step into a world of secrets for this one-night-only prohibition-style speakeasy, packed with live jazz, bootleg cocktails, and a dance floor ready for rebels and romantics alike. Slip past the watchful eye of the ‘authorities’ and step into a world where love is bold, the drinks flow freely, and the music never stops. Enjoy handcrafted cocktails featuring The Bond Store’s award-winning spirits, paired with decadent bites designed for sharing. The night kicks off with big brass energy from a live jazz band, leading into a high-energy celebration of love, freedom, and the thrill of breaking the rules. Drape yourself in 1920s glamour, grab your partner in crime, and prepare for a night of indulgence, mischief, and unforgettable memories. But remember...loose lips sink ships, so keep the password hush-hush.

description:
Jazz Composer Series | Blair Latham And Anton Wuts, Sh*t gets Wild

Anton and Blair at the Rogue!

Anton Wuts and Blair Latham are back orchestrating their head turning take on music for a large ensemble, but this time with a new twist. 
TWO quintets!

Drums and Bass and Harmony and Horns, Drums and Bass and Harmony and Horns, are they side by side or head to head?? Do they work in harmony, (so to speak), for the betterment of all ears or do they take a cue from the world around us??

Only the music can and will divulge its sonorous secrets.
Join them and their cohorts on Friday the 17th of October 7pm.

Shaun Anderson & Peter Elliot ~ Drum kit

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Callum Allardice, The eleventh concert in our series of Aotearoa jazz composers features award winning composer and performer Callum Allardice, with a new suite of music for rhythm section and strings; Ode to Sadness.
A collection of songs, old and new, presented alongside some of the works that inspired them. From intimate improvisations and poignant melodies to soaring strings, the music moves through moments of reverence, reflection, and quiet triumph. Sometimes solemn, sometimes radiant, but always beautiful, Ode To Sadness is a celebration of the beauty found in sorrow.

Callum is an award-winning composer and guitarist based in New Zealand. He is a three-time recipient of the APRA Best Jazz Composition award for his works ‘Sons of Thunder’ (2016), ‘Deep Thought’ (2017), and ‘Chungin’ (2019). In 2020 he and his group The Jac, received the Recorded Music NZ Best Jazz Artist award for their album ‘A Gathering’, and in 2022 he was the inaugural Te Kōkī - New Zealand School of Music jazz composer-in-residence.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.
Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Louisa Williamson, The ninth concert in this series of Aotearoa composers features the multi-talented saxophonist/composer Louisa Williamson.

Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other.  Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo.

This commission opportunity has come at a perfect time for me to process some recent grief and pain that’s inhabited my circles. Whilst composing this music, I’ve thought about ideas around mental health, specifically with youth in Aotearoa, and also honouring some friends who have passed. I think artists have the ability to turn heartbreak into beauty, and this music is an attempt at that. Although the inspiration which generated the music is heavy, the performance itself will hopefully feel light and reflective (turning heartbreak into beauty = darkness into light!), and will embrace and celebrate the talents of the musicians who are playing. I’ve brought together a beautiful group of people who I know will handle this music with care and fortitude

Bryn van Vliet - alto/flute
Tyaan Singh - alto sax
Louisa Williamson - tenor/flute
Eilish Wilson - baritone sax
Sylvester Green - trumpet
Kaia Johnstone - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Jakob Elijas - trombone
Anna Lee - euphonium
Sam Zhu - tuba
Leonardo Coghini - piano
Jacob Hurst - bass
Max Sheehan - drums

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix.com, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: John Rae, Award-winning composer and musician John Rae invites you to an
enchanting evening of Celtic-inspired music that promises to get your feet tapping and your ears thumping. This large ensemble draws on both new and traditional melodies, reimagined in a style that reflects Rae’s cultural roots and personal musical journey. Experience a vibrant celebration of Celtic heritage through engaging rhythms and rich harmonies that showcase the versatility and depth of contemporary Celtic music.
John has recorded over 30 albums as a leader and side man including two BBC Jazz Albums of the Year (2003 and 2004). He has performed with the Scottish National Jazz Orchestra, was the first ever Jazz Composer in Residence at Victoria University, has written music for the NZSO/Wellington Jazz Orchestra and RNZAF Concert Band, and has toured internationally with his eclectic chamber ensemble "The Troubles".
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.

description:
Jess and Cam, Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.

She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.

Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.

Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.

Tickets $20 or $10 for Capital Blues Inc members.
10% discount at the bar for food and drinks for members.

description:
Jodie and the Stowaways // WILD WEST PARTY @ The RSC, Jodie and the Stowaways // WILD WEST PARTY @ The RSC
WILD WEST PARTY // Emma’s 40th
All welcome!

Fronted by the dynamic vocals and engaging presence of Jodie Gummer, Jodie & The Stowaways have been playing together for more than a decade – entertaining crowds, engaging audiences, and delivering musical entertainment like no other.

Armed with an extensive setlist to cater to any venue or occasion, this energetic band is all about slick performance, a well-rehearsed repertoire, and a presence that will surprise and delight you and your guests.

With a particular passion for pop/rock expect to hear sounds from Led Zepplin and Audioslave to Fleetwood Mac and No Doubt.

Here are some videos to show you what we are about. Ww have a tonne on Youtube if you look up Jodie and The Stowaways.

description:
Jonathan Crayford - Bikes in Space tickets, Presented by: Jonathan Crayford
Jonathan Crayford introduces his latest project 'Bikes In Space' an electronic vintage keys and drums driven fully improvised groove space junk ensemble that sounds like what it might be like to be in the brain of Philip K Dick, Ursula Le Guin or Margaret St Clair - except more. After a 2 month tour of Auckland, they hit Nui with added punch to the drums featuring Riki Pirihi and Julien Dyne.
Jonathan Crayford keys, Joe Kaptein keys, Riki Pirihi drums, Julien Dyne drums.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
KORA tickets, Presented by: Eccles Entertainment
Kora are back - and sound bigger, deeper and more electrifying than ever. With a long-awaited new album on the horizon, and a tour to match, the iconic Aotearoa band is set to reawaken the hearts of fans both old and new.
Known as one of the country’s most powerful and dynamic acts fusing elements of roots, reggae, funk, rock, dub, and electronic music into a sonic identity that is entirely their own. Their music is heavy and melodic and grounded in kaupapa Māori, driven by innovation, storytelling, and groove.
Their performances bring together heavy bass, soaring vocals, and raw energy, blending musical mastery with raw power to create an immersive experience. Whether headlining major festivals or packing out venues around Aotearoa, Kora’s ability to move a crowd is unmatched.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Kids Rock 4 Palestine, Kids Rock For Palestine
One Day. One Stage. One Cause.
This event is organised by kids in Pōneke to raise funds for kids in Palestine.
Join us for a one-day-only music fundraiser where young voices take centre stage to amplify hope and raise money for children in Palestine.
Under-18 musicians, solo artists, and bands (some joined by over-18 allies) are coming together to rock out with purpose, showing that music knows no borders and compassion has no age limit.
These young performers are using their talents to stand in solidarity with kids just like them who are living through unimaginable circumstances.
Organiser Eddie 12: "We see children in Palestine who are being bombed and shot and are starving. We kids want to help. So that is what we are doing."
There will be stalls and crafting available for kids attending - Please come and support so we can raise money for Gaza's families.
100% of proceeds go directly to emergency aid and child-focused relief in Palestine - Convoys of Good and Kiwi Trust for Palestinian Childrens Relief.
Witness the next generation of artists and activists sharing the stage and raising their voices. Please support them with your attendance. Show them young people can make a difference.
Be part of an event where music becomes action, and community becomes change.
Do you want to volunteer to help? Email aotearoa2gaza@gmail.com
ALL UNDER 18s MUST ATTEND WITH A PARENT OR GUARDIAN.
Can’t make it? Donate anyway!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Kingston Rose On Tour - Moon, Join Kingston Rose, an emerging artist from Wellington, on his North Island tour.
After releasing his debut album Violet Heartbreak earlier this year, Kingston is back with his brand-new single “Don’t Even Know Why” — a passionate, emotionally relatable pop track.
This tour will showcase an energetic live performance, bringing his heartfelt songs to life with the support of talented musicians. It also marks the first official tour from his own label, Wilfred Records, which is dedicated to creating positive change and accessible support for artists across Aotearoa.
Support from Pony Grove, Doors at 8pm, $20 Cash or Card.

description:
Lacuna Presents - Us Two tickets, Presented by: Lacuna
Us Two is a high-energy house DJ act from the Midlands, UK, with releases on some of the world's most respected labels including Knee Deep In Sound, MicroHertz, and Eastenderz. Known for deep grooves, rolling basslines, and infectious crowd connection, Us Two has earned support from global heavyweights like Marco Carola, Jamie Jones, and Skream.
From European festival stages to Ibiza's 528 for a standout set with Knee Deep In Sound, Us Two's sound blends underground credibility with dancefloor-ready energy.
His latest release, "Simulation" (featuring Franksy), drops on Pete Tong's TSZR label, and has already earned plays from tastemakers like ANOTR, SG Lewis, LF SYSTEM, and SOSA, with early reactions going wild at Music On (Pacha Ibiza) and beyond.
For Lacuna, hosting Us Two’s debut in Wellington is about more than a headline — it's personal. We're thrilled to finally bring a dear friend's sound to our city and invite you to feel the energy first-hand on Saturday, 20 September 2025, at Meow Nui.
Packages
label: Music & Concerts

description: Laurel Canyon - Linda Rondstadt with The Eagles, Get ready for an evening of exceptional talent and timeless music as Sue Dyson, Todd Sutton, and Grant Wills pay tribute to two of the most iconic names in American music - Linda Ronstadt and The Eagles. Laurel Canyon isn’t just a tribute – It’s a celebration of a musical era that defined a generation. From Linda’s powerful ballads to The Eagles’ signature harmonies, this show captures the spirit, sound and soul of Southern California’s golden age of rock and folk.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Lauren Nottingham | Notman Meehan Quartet, Composer/pianist Norman Meehan and vocalist Lauren Nottingham lead a captivating voyage through poetry and sound, where words become ships to other worlds.

Joined by Blair Latham (bass clarinet, guitar) and Andrew Laking (double bass), this ECM-inspired quartet presents a performance brimming with intimacy and emotional depth—charting a course through Norman’s original compositions and the far horizons of jazz.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Lawrence Arabia Is Playing A Solo Show, It’s been six years since he last released an album and, like Richard Prebble before him, Lawrence Arabia’s been thinking.


When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.


The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.


With support from Frances Grass.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Liam Cooper’s King of the Keys, He’s a modern-day piano man singing the songs of famous piano men. Australian Liam Cooper intends to thrill an audience at The Opera House with a concert of famous songs. In Liam Cooper’s show King of the Keys, the entertainer will celebrate the music of Elton John, Peter Allen, Billy Joel, Stevie Wonder, Freddie Mercury, Ray Charles, and more. A killer live band will help him negotiate a nostalgic catalogue of 40 classic songs from 15 musical legends. 
Along with faithful renditions of many songs, Liam will captivate you with the stories behind them. Learn about who Paul McCartney wrote ‘Let It Be’ for, and what Elton John’s ‘Bennie & The Jets’ satirises. You’ll get a new appreciation for the songs that have become anthems for generations. 
In a final twist, the audience gets to choose how the show ends. You’ll be able to use your phone to vote live in the theatre. Decide who is the one true ‘King of the Keys’ to influence the show’s unique conclusion.
label: Music & Concerts

dj, edm, electronic, Kakapo

description:
Louisa Williamson Quintet, Louisa Williamson presents music from her latest album, Groundwork, plus more recent compositions.

Louisa Williamson is a saxophonist, flutist, composer and arranger based in Wellington. Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other. Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo. In 2016 Louisa was the first New Zealander to successfully audition for the JMI Jazz World Orchestra (consisting of the best young jazz musicians from around the world, aged 18-25), touring Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Slovenia and Croatia.

Featuring: Louisa Williamson 9saxophone), Callum Allardice (guitar), Daniel Hayles (piano), Johnny Lawrence (bass), Max Sheehan (drums).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MESSIE - Wellington, MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Maddy Low, The Undercurrent presents Maddy Low

Singer-songwriter Maddy Low performs original songs, acoustic-pop, indie-folk/rock, layered vocals, intricate guitar and quietly powerful songwriting.
Honest, intimate songs that leave a mark.

Listen here: ⁦https://www.youtube.com/@maddylmusic⁩

Maddy will be joined by supporting acts Lucy Summerfield and PEBBLE.

Lucy Summerfield is an 18-year-old singer-songwriter from Te Tauihu, now living in Wellington. She writes in both te Reo Māori and English. At The Undercurrent she will be performing original songs with cello accompaniment.

PEBBLE is an indie folk-pop artist, songwriter and traveler, often based in Aotearoa. For the last 2 years, he has travelled through Asia, Europe and Latin America, creating and releasing songs in every country he has been.

Sunday 28th September
Doors 5pm/ Gig 5:30pm
$15
Tickets available online & the door

Wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

See you there!

description:
Mallrat | Wellington (SOLD OUT), Australian indie pop princess Mallrat will return to New Zealand this September on the Light Hit My Face Like a Straight Right World Tour, following a run of sold out shows across Europe and USA.
Sophomore album Light Hit My Face Like A Straight brings dance music that has heart and potent magic which will be manifested into life on stage, alongside all your favourite Mallrat hits and accompanied by her incredible live band.
The adored songwriter and producer’s work catapulted Mallrat across the globe with critical acclaim from NPR, Stereogum, NME, NYLON, PAPER Magazine, The New York Times, Billboard, Noisey and more, further affirming Mallrat as a beacon primed for the world stage in 2025.
Joining Mallrat on her New Zealand headline shows is none other than Aotearoa’s own indie pop darling, Riiki Reid — bringing her signature style and infectious energy to the stage for an unforgettable night of music.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Maracatui, Get ready for a night of pulsating Brazilian rhythms as Maracatui ignites the stage at Rogue and
Vagabond.

Rooted in the rich cultural traditions of northeast Brazil, this vibrant collective of musicians and vocalists honours the powerful percussion and soulful songs created by past generations. Maracatui has evolved over the years, blending traditional sounds with original compositions and modern production techniques to create a sound that's both authentic and new.

Known for their infectious energy, Maracatui's performances are an irresistible invitation for audience participation. Their unique blend of powerful beats and beautiful melodies creates a communal experience that will leave you feeling uplifted.

And to be honest, the beer is also stellar! We love Rogue!

Music from 9:30
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Monteverdi Vespers (Vespro della Beata Vergine of 1610), Join award-winning choir The Tudor Consort for our major project of the year! This will be the first time this groundbreaking work has been performed in Wellington for over a decade.


Juxtaposing Renaissance melodies and polyphony with the rich virtuosity and colour of Baroque instruments, intimate vocal solos with a choir and orchestra of unprecedented grandeur, and dazzling opulence with striking emotional and spiritual depth, this will be an unmissable performance



We are thrilled to be joined by an incredible orchestra of top musicians from the NZSO and leading international artists! Come hear the striking tones of cornetti, dulcian, archlutes, Baroque recorders and more!



N.B. There will be a pre-concert talk at 7pm.
label: Music & Concerts
